0.title: Have utmost respect for religious beliefs: Samsung Pak after being accused of blasphemy
0.article_body: Samsung's Pakistan unit issued a statement as violent protests erupted in a Karachi mall after the multinational company was accused of blasphemy by a mob. Samsung said it "has utmost respect for all religious sentiments", adding that it has initiated a probe into the matter. Reportedly, over 20 Samsung employees were detained over this.

1.title: Criminal conspiracy, evidence destruction charges added against Alt News Co-founder
1.article_body: Delhi Police has added criminal conspiracy and the destruction of evidence charges in the case against Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair. "The accused received donations from foreign countries," it added. In the FIR, Section 35 in The Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act, 2010, has now been added. Zubair was arrested in a case related to an alleged objectionable tweet in 2018.

2.title: 15 kg tumour removed from woman’s abdomen at Patna hospital
2.article_body: An ovarian tumour, weighing about 15 kg, was surgically removed from the abdomen of a 40-year-old woman at a government hospital in Patna. The patient was admitted to Nalanda Medical College and Hospital with abdominal pain and swelling complaints. "The tumour was...largest ever to have been surgically extracted in our department," the doctor who headed the surgery said.

3.title: Punjab man stabs 11-yr-old boy to death over minor argument; held
3.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly stabbed an 11-year-old boy to death following a minor argument in Punjab's Ludhiana. The boy was selling boiled eggs on a cart near his house when the incident occurred, according to police. The deceased's mother claimed that onlookers had caught the accused, who was holding a "blood-soaked knife in his hand".

4.title: Colombia extradites sister of accused drug cartel leader to US
4.article_body: Colombia has extradited the sister of accused drug cartel leader Dairo Usaga to the US to face drug trafficking charges, police said. Colombian police accuse Nini Usaga of money laundering for the Clan del Golfo cartel and coordinating drug shipments abroad. Her brother, accused head of Clan del Golfo, was extradited to face drug trafficking charges in US in May.

5.title: 5 killed, 12 injured as earthquake of 6.0 magnitude hits Iran
5.article_body: At least five people have been killed and 12 others have been injured after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake hit southern Iran on Saturday, state television reported. Rescue teams have been deployed near the epicentre Sayeh Khosh village, home to around 300 people. Iran's deadliest quake was a 7.4-magnitude tremor that struck in 1990, killing 40,000 people in the country's north.

6.title: Fabulous given India were 98/5: Bishop on Pant-Jadeja's record stand
6.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Ian Bishop said the partnership of 222 runs between Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja in India's first innings of the fifth rescheduled Test against England was "fabulous", considering India were 98/5. Their partnership is India's highest-ever stand for the sixth-wicket against England in Test cricket. Pant scored 146 runs while Jadeja is currently unbeaten on 83 runs.

7.title: He has put India so far ahead in the 5th Test: Agarkar on Pant's 146
7.article_body: Former India pacer Ajit Agarkar said Rishabh Pant's 146 in India's first innings of the fifth rescheduled Test against England has put his team "so far ahead" in the ongoing match. "[Pant's style of play] shouldn't come as a surprise. It is...good for India that he has kept repeating it," added Agarkar. "Pant came into the Test...being...under pressure," stated Agarkar.

8.title: PM can't change my behaviour by making me sit in ED office: Rahul
8.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who was questioned recently by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case, said that PM Modi cannot change his behaviour by making him sit in the ED office for five days. "This is a confusion in...mind of the Prime Minister," he added. "My behaviour...can never be shaped by my opponents or...enemies," Rahul further said.

9.title: Manipur landslide worst incident in state's history: CM as death toll rises to 20
9.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Friday said that the landslide in Noney was the "worst incident" in the state's history. This comes as the death toll from the incident rose to 20, according to an Indian Army statement. The CM added that 81 people were lost in the landslide, of which 18 were rescued and 55 are still trapped.

10.title: Saviour has spoken: Arjun after Kartik praises trailer of Ek Villain Returns
10.article_body: Kartik Aaryan took to his Instagram Stories to praise the trailer of Arjun Kapoor's upcoming movie 'Ek Villain Returns', writing, "Superb Trailer. Killing It With The Villains. Mohit Suri sir (director) your world is fantastic as always." Arjun wrote, "Saviour has spoken," reacting to Kartik's post. Kartik's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' earned more than ₹200 crore at the worldwide box office.

11.title: What multiple records did Rishabh Pant break with his 146(111) against England?
11.article_body: Rishabh Pant set the record for smashing the fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper, taking 89 deliveries during the fifth Test against England. During his 111-ball 146-run knock, Pant also became the youngest Indian to reach 100 sixes in international cricket aged 24 years and 271 days. He also became the youngest wicketkeeper-batter to reach 2,000 Test runs.

12.title: What alternatives can be adopted in daily life as single-use plastic banned in India?
12.article_body: The government has shared some alternatives that can be adopted in daily life as single-use plastic has been banned in India. Khadi bags, bamboo straws and cutlery, stainless steel straws, fluid ear care products and reusable glasses and cups are among the alternatives. Bamboo stirrers and stainless steel lunch boxes can also be used as alternatives.

13.title: Building used as office, not residence: UP govt on Prayagraj demolition
13.article_body: Commenting on demolition of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammad's house, Uttar Pradesh government said that the building was not being used for residential purposes but as the office of the Welfare Party of India. It added that the demolition was not connected to the June 10 Prayagraj violence. Javed's wife has moved Allahabad HC claiming the demolition to be illegal.

14.title: 30-yr-old man gets 1-yr jail for shouting ‘I love you’ at minor in Mumbai
14.article_body: A 30-year-old man was sentenced to one-year rigorous imprisonment for shouting 'I love you' at a 13-year-old girl in 2015. The convict, who lived in the girl's neighbourhood, stalked her for about 15 days. A complaint was lodged against him after he tried to come close to her while she was once returning home with her mother after buying textbooks.

15.title: Shinde, Fadnavis will bring Maha back on track of development: Scindia
15.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Friday welcomed the formation of a new government in Maharashtra under rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde. "I'm confident Shinde as CM and Devendra Fadnavis as Deputy CM will bring Maharashtra back on...road of development," Scindia added. He claimed that the previous MVA government was acting like a speed-breaker in Maharashtra's development.

16.title: Delhi Fire Services to get 89 new additional fire trucks
16.article_body: The Delhi Fire Services (DFS) will soon get 89 new additional fire trucks as the department is currently in the process of purchasing them, officials said. It will help DFS improve their response time and overcome the shortage of fire tenders, DFS Chief Atul Garg said. Notably, DFS' 60 diesel-based fire trucks have reached their expiry time of 10 years.

17.title: India reports 17,092 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,09,568
17.article_body: India has reported 17,092 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 17,070 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,09,568, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,168, according to the latest data.

18.title: Crypto hedge fund Three Arrows files for Chapter 15 bankruptcy in US
18.article_body: Cryptocurrency hedge fund Three Arrows Capital (3AC) has filed for Chapter 15 of the US Bankruptcy Code, which allows foreign debtors to shield US assets. Singapore-based 3AC is one of the highest-profile investors hit by the sharp sell-off in cryptocurrency markets. Notably, the company had reportedly managed an estimated $10 billion in assets as recently as March.

19.title: J&K Police help Amarnath pilgrims cross flooded bridges, share videos
19.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police on Friday shared videos of its rescue teams helping pilgrims travelling to Amarnath cave cross two bridges that had got blocked and flooded amid heavy rains. A video shows the police officers standing in a queue as they helped people cross while heavy water flowed. The bridges were located at Brari Marg and Y junction.

20.title: Hope Rocketry becomes as successful as Kashmir Files: Vivek Agnihotri
20.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has reacted to an article saying R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' has the advantage of good word-of-mouth, and is likely to repeat the success of the former's 'The Kashmir Files'. "From the bottom of my heart, I wish this happens and I'm sure it'll happen because Madhavan is one of the most honest [actors]," Vivek said.

21.title: Chef from Taj used to cook for him: Manoj Pahwa recalls eating with Rishi
21.article_body: Actor Manoj Pahwa has said Rishi Kapoor asked him to eat with him during the shoot of 'Mulk' in Lucknow. "A chef from Taj hotel used to cook for him...Being a Kapoor, his food was spread out on the entire table," he added. "There were four types of mutton, four kinds of chicken, five kinds of sweets," Manoj further said.

22.title: Delhi Police arrest murderer absconding for last 15 years
22.article_body: In a 15-year-old kidnapping and murder case, the Delhi Police have arrested the main suspect after hunting him since 2007. The suspect, Hari Om, is accused of abducting and killing a man, Mahesh Choudhary, with the help of his friend, Rakesh, near a village in Kanpur. Notably, Om was arrested from his residence in Kanpur Dehat's Jathiapur village, police said.

23.title: Smoke spotted inside Delhi-Jabalpur SpiceJet flight while it was passing 5,000 feet
23.article_body: A Delhi-Jabalpur SpiceJet flight returned to the Delhi airport after the crew noticed smoke inside the plane while passing 5,000 feet. All the passengers were safely disembarked, a SpiceJet spokesperson said. The SG 2962 flight had taken off at around 6.30 am today and was originally scheduled to reach Jabalpur at around 8 am.

24.title: Bezos' superyacht stuck as firm decides against dismantling bridge to let it sail
24.article_body: Jeff Bezos' $500 million superyacht is stuck after the Dutch firm building it decided against dismantling a bridge following public backlash, Dutch news outlet Trouw reported. Oceanco had earlier said it needed to have the bridge taken apart in order to allow the superyacht to sail. Trouw used freedom of information legislation to find out more about the firm's plan.

25.title: Public toilet caretaker gets life term for raping 9-yr-old girl in Mumbai
25.article_body: A 25-year-old public toilet caretaker was sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a 9-year-old girl inside the toilet where he worked. The girl said that on November 5, 2019, when she was about to exit the toilet after using it, the convict entered inside and assaulted her sexually. He allegedly gave her ₹20 and threatened her to not reveal anything.

26.title: 46-yr-old man arrested for raping niece for past 5 years in Mumbai
26.article_body: The Mumbai Police have arrested a 46-year-old man for allegedly sexually exploiting his niece for the past five years. The accused initially raped the 20-year-old victim at a hotel in Andheri and subsequently raped her on multiple occasions at various places, police said. "The accused is said to have videographed some of the acts," said Assistant Police Inspector Santosh Kamble.

27.title: Pak journalist attacked after calling Army generals 'property dealers'
27.article_body: A 73-year-old Pakistan journalist was allegedly assaulted by unidentified men in Lahore on Friday night, a day after calling Pakistan's Army generals "property dealers". Ayaz Amir said the unidentified men dragged him out of his car, hit him and tore his clothes. Ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan condemned the incident, saying, "Pakistan is descending into the worst kind of fascism."

28.title: Stokes ran out of ideas, Eng bowlers lost patience: Zaheer on Day 1
28.article_body: Former India pacer Zaheer Khan said England Test captain Ben Stokes "ran out of ideas" at one stage on Day 1 of the fifth rescheduled Test against India. "The England bowlers lost their patience...After tea...they pitched it either too full or too short. England had to bring in the spinners because of the poor run rate and...tiring pacers," he added.

29.title: Rajasthan government suspends Udaipur ASP days after tailor's beheading
29.article_body: Rajasthan government on Friday suspended Udaipur Additional Superintendent of Police (ASP) Ashok Meena days after a tailor, identified as Kanhaiya Lal, was beheaded by two men. Notably, the order issued by the Joint Secretary (Police) of the state home department does not mention the reason for suspension. Earlier, Rajasthan Police suspended an Assistant Sub-Inspector and a station house officer.

30.title: Pak tech body warns of internet shutdown amid power outages, later deletes tweet
30.article_body: Amid frequent power outages due to the country's economic crisis, Pakistan's National Information Technology Board (NIBT) tweeted that the telecom operators in the country have warned about shutting down mobile and internet services. It added that the long hours of power outages have caused hindrance in their operations. However, NIBT later deleted this tweet.

31.title: If India win the Test, it will be his best knock ever: Jaffer on Pant's 146
31.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant's 146 in India's first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against England, Wasim Jaffer said, "If India...win the Test and series, this will stand on top of everything (Pant's best knocks)." "It is hard to put anything in front of that [89* at the] Gabba," added Jaffer. Pant's 146 comprised 20 fours and four sixes.

32.title: There was fear of riots under Congress rule in Gujarat: Amit Shah
32.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Friday said that people feared riots during Jagannath Rath Yatra under Congress rule in Gujarat. "During Congress rule in Gujarat, have you seen any Rath Yatra procession that has gone smoothly?" Shah asked. "Such incidents of violence occurred back then. Twice, the Lord's [Jagannath] chariot [for the Yatra] was taken away," he added.

33.title: 4 villages to get sewer lines, 3 lakh people to benefit: Delhi Dy CM
33.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that four villages and 36 unauthorised colonies in the national capital will get sewer lines, following which around three lakh people will benefit. The areas include Bijwasan, Najafgarh, Shikarpur, Burari and Sangam Vihar. "Currently, sewage from these areas is discharged into local ponds...which later goes indirectly into the Yamuna," Sisodia added.

34.title: Bengaluru police arrest Nigerian national, seize ₹20 lakh-drugs
34.article_body: A 34-year-old Nigerian national was arrested for allegedly selling prohibited drugs in Bengaluru, DCP (South Division) P Krishnakant tweeted on Friday. The police also seized drugs worth ₹20 lakh, cash, a two-wheeler and a phone from the accused's possession. The accused had come to India on a business visa three years ago and lives a luxurious life, the police said.

35.title: Google to delete users' location history if they visit US abortion clinics
35.article_body: Google has announced it would delete users' location history if they visit US abortion clinics, domestic violence shelters and other places where privacy is sought. This comes a week after the US Supreme Court rolled back abortion rights. Without giving a reference to abortion, Google said it will continue to push back against improper demands for data by the government.

36.title: Hyd will be renamed Bhagyanagar if BJP elected in T'gana: BJP leader
36.article_body: BJP leader and former Jharkhand CM Raghubar Das said Hyderabad's name will be changed to Bhagyanagar if BJP comes to power in Telangana. "They [TRS government] don't think about the welfare of the people of Telangana. So people are in favour of BJP," Das claimed. PM Modi will address the national executive meeting to end the dynasty politics, he added.

37.title: Over 300 EV charging stations to come up in Hyderabad
37.article_body: In order to cut down carbon emissions, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to set up 230 electric vehicle (EV) charging stations across the city. Besides this, the Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) has also proposed to install 100 EV charging stations in its jurisdiction. The stations will reportedly come up in areas where vehicular traffic is heavy.

38.title: 2 attack couple with weapons, rob mangalsutra worth ₹60,000 in Pune
38.article_body: A case was filed after a 42-year-old man and his wife were allegedly attacked by two persons with sword-like weapons in the ghat area in Pune. During the incident, the accused hit the husband on the head and snatched a mangalsutra worth ₹60,000 from the wife, according to police. The accused also stole the husband's phone, a police officer said.

39.title: Uddhav removes Maha CM Shinde as Sena leader over 'anti-party activities'
39.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Friday removed the new Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde from the post of leader in the party. "You have been indulging in anti-party activities...have also voluntarily given up your membership of Sena," he wrote in a letter addressed to Shinde. "You cannot abandon Sena and claim to be a Sena CM," Thackeray had said earlier.

40.title: US sending 2 surface-to-air missile systems to Ukraine: Pentagon
40.article_body: The US has said it'd provide Ukraine with $820 million in new military aid. Two NASAMS surface-to-air missile systems, four additional counter-artillery radars and up to 150,000 rounds of 155mm artillery ammunition would be sent as part of the package, Pentagon said. The US has now committed around $6.9 billion to Ukraine since Russia began invading it on February 24.

41.title: Actress Alexandra Daddario marries boyfriend Andrew Form, shares pics
41.article_body: Actress Alexandra Daddario tied the knot with her boyfriend, producer Andrew Form. The duo started dating each other in 2021 before getting engaged in August 2021. Daddario took to Instagram to share pictures from her wedding. Daddario's 'Baywatch' co-star Priyanka Chopra congratulated the couple, writing, "Stunning. Congratulations to you both."

42.title: Pic of Dravid's 'screaming' celebration after Pant's hundred goes viral, fans react
42.article_body: A picture of Team India head coach Rahul Dravid's celebration after Rishabh Pant smashed a hundred against England in the rescheduled fifth Test has gone viral. After Pant reached the three-figure mark, Dravid jumped from his chair and screamed with both his hands in the air. "Have never seen Dravid celebrating like this," a fan commented. "Absolute gold," wrote another.

43.title: Sidhu Moosewala's photo seen on election posters in Pakistan; pic surfaces
43.article_body: Photo of singer Sidhu Moosewala was seen on election posters in Pakistan, with a picture of a poster surfacing online. Moosewala's photo was used on the posters of former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's party Tehreek-e-Insaf. "This poster has gone very viral because of his picture. None of our posters had gone so viral before," party leader Zain Qureshi said.

44.title: Nearly 700 kg of single-use plastic items seized in Delhi on day 1 of ban
44.article_body: Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) on Friday seized 689.01 kg of single-use plastic items and issued 368 challans on day one of the countrywide ban. "Total of 125 enforcement teams...constituted at the zonal level to eliminate stocking, sale and usage of banned items," MCD said. The ban on single-use plastic items in India came into effect on Friday.

45.title: Pant-Jadeja's record partnership helps India end Day 1 of 5th Test vs England at 338/7
45.article_body: India ended the first day of the rescheduled fifth Test against England at Edgbaston at 338/7. The day witnessed Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja share a partnership of 222 runs, which is the highest-ever sixth-wicket stand for India against England in Test cricket. Pant also broke the record for the fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper, taking 89 deliveries.

46.title: UK records over 30% increase in new COVID-19 cases since last week
46.article_body: The UK recorded over 30% increase in the number of new COVID-19 cases in the last week, fueled by the highly contagious Omicron variant, the Office for National Statistics said on Friday. Data showed over 3 million people in the UK had coronavirus in the last week, though a corresponding increase in hospitalisations and related deaths was not seen.

47.title: Sweden, Finland must extradite Kurdish 'terrorists': Turkish Prez
47.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has warned his country's Parliament could still block Sweden and Finland's entry into NATO, if the Nordic nations do not extradite Kurdish leaders designated as "terrorists" by Ankara. Sweden has vowed to extradite 73 people, Erdogan said. Historically neutral Finland and Sweden are set to join NATO, amid a perceived threat from Russia.

48.title: ULFA cadre killed in encounter with forces in Assam's Tinsukia
48.article_body: An encounter broke out between United Liberation Front of Asom cadres and security forces in Assam's Tinsukia district earlier on Friday. Police received information regarding infiltration by six ULFA cadres, following which an operation was launched by security forces, SP Tinsukia informed. An encounter broke out during the operation in which a cadre of the group was killed, he added.

49.title: My saree fell, someone hit my breast: Actress on ordeal after arrest over post on Pawar
49.article_body: Marathi actress Ketaki Chitale, who was arrested over an allegedly derogatory social media post about NCP chief Sharad Pawar, alleged she was molested after her arrest. "I was wearing a sari, my pallu fell down, someone tripped me over, hit me, hit my right breast," she told CNN-News18. "When they hit me, I fell into the police car," she added.

50.title: When in trouble, call Spiderman: Mishra on Pant's ton in 5th Test vs England
50.article_body: Following India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant's 89-ball hundred in first innings of rescheduled fifth England-India Test, Amit Mishra tweeted, "When in trouble, call the Spiderman! What a fierce knock by rockstar Pant against a quality English bowling unit under such circumstances." Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter and wrote, "Top knock 100...when team needed the most...keep it up."

51.title: Russian envoy to urge Kremlin to close embassy in Bulgaria
51.article_body: Russia's ambassador to Bulgaria, Eleonora Mitrofanova, on Friday said that she would urge the Kremlin to shut down the Russian embassy in Sofia after the host country ignored Moscow's appeals to reconsider expelling 70 Russian diplomats. She further said that her action "will inevitably entail the closure of the Bulgarian diplomatic mission in Moscow".

52.title: Bangladesh to start deradicalisation campaign for jailed Islamists
52.article_body: Bangladesh will launch a deradicalisation campaign for Islamists in its jails, officials said on Friday. "The initiative is aimed to prevent the jailed militants' return to the path of militancy," a spokesman of police's Counter Terrorism and Transnational Crime (CTTC) unit said. Under the project, the CTTC will rehabilitate 20 militants in the next year, the spokesman added.

53.title: Djokovic beats Kecmanovic to reach Wimbledon last 16 for 14th time
53.article_body: Defending champion Novak Djokovic entered fourth round at Wimbledon for the 14th time after beating fellow Serb Miomir Kecmanovic 6-0, 6-3, 6-4 on Friday. It was his 24th consecutive win on grass. Djokovic will now face Dutch wild card Tim van Rijthoven, who beat Nikoloz Basilashvili 6-4, 6-3, 6-4 to enter fourth round on his Grand Slam main draw debut.

54.title: How much wealth have the world's richest people lost in the last 6 months?
54.article_body: World's 500 richest people lost $1.4 trillion in the first half of 2022, marking the steepest six-month drop ever for the global billionaire group, Bloomberg reported. While the world's richest person Elon Musk lost $61.8 billion, Jeff Bezos saw his wealth decline by $62.7 billion. Mark Zuckerberg's net worth has plunged by more than half to $60 billion in 2022.

55.title: NATO in talks to build naval base in Albania: PM Edi Rama
55.article_body: Albanian PM Edi Rama on Friday said that Albania is in talks with NATO to build a naval base at Porto Romano, a port under construction on its coast. The port will also have a commercial section, Rama added. "We'll soon go back to Brussels to continue our discussions regarding our proposal...for...installation of a NATO naval base," he further said.

56.title: Please stop broadcast of false information: Meena after husband's death
56.article_body: Actress Meena, whose husband recently passed away at the age of 48, penned a note on social media requesting the media to respect her privacy. She wrote, "I am deeply saddened by the loss of my loving husband Vidya Sagar...Please stop further broadcast of any false information on this matter." Meena also thanked her medical team, CM and Health Minister.

57.title: Bajrang Dal, VHP members booked for slogans at Gurugram protest over Udaipur killing
57.article_body: Two days after Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) members staged a protest in Gurugram demanding stringent punishment for the killers of Udaipur tailor, police booked the organisers and participants of the rally. Police said the protesters allegedly raised abusive slogans and tried to promote enmity between communities. At least 80 people had assembled at Nehru Park on Wednesday.

58.title: Encephalitis death rate down by 95%, it will soon be erased: UP CM
58.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday said that the death rate due to encephalitis has gone down by 95% and the disease will soon be eradicated from the state. "Awareness, inter-departmental coordination and teamwork play a big role in this," Yogi Adityanath said. "Affected children should not be taken to quacks, but to specialists in government hospitals," he added.

59.title: US basketball player Griner goes on trial in Russia on drug charges
59.article_body: American professional basketball player Brittney Griner was produced before a Russian court on the outskirts of Moscow on Friday as she went on trial under drug-related charges. Speaking to Reuters, her lawyers refused to disclose if she would plead guilty or not. Griner was detained at a Moscow airport earlier this year for allegedly carrying vaporiser cartridges containing hashish oil.

60.title: Pant smashes fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper, breaks Dhoni's record
60.article_body: Rishabh Pant on Friday smashed the fastest hundred by a Team India wicketkeeper in Test cricket. The 24-year-old set the record by reaching the three-figure mark off 89 deliveries against England in first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test. The previous fastest Test hundred by an India wicketkeeper was hit by MS Dhoni off 93 deliveries against Pakistan in 2006.

61.title: Accused in Kanhaiya killing paid extra money to get '2611' as his motorbike number
61.article_body: Riyaz Akhtari, a prime accused in Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal's beheading, had paid extra money to get '2611' on his bike's registration number, authorities have said. As per reports, the registration number RJ 27 AS 2611 is a reference to 2008 Mumbai terror attacks. The bike has been confiscated and was reportedly used by Akhtari to flee the murder scene.

62.title: Randeep Hooda to hold prayer meet for Sarabjit's sister Dalbir
62.article_body: Actor Randeep Hooda will be holding a prayer meeting for Sarabjit Singh's sister Dalbir Kaur on July 4. He had earlier penned a note for her following her demise due to a heart attack. Randeep had also performed her last rites. The actor had reportedly promised he would give 'kandha' (shoulder) to her mortal remains after her death.

63.title: Surbhi Tiwari files FIR against husband, in-laws over domestic violence
63.article_body: Television actress Surbhi Tiwari has filed an FIR against husband Delhi-based pilot and businessman Praveen Kumar Sinha, his mother and his sisters-in-law for domestic violence. She claimed Praveen was supposed to move to Mumbai but later refused. "I haven't got my stree dhan back...If I had...I wouldn't have to sell my gold ornaments for survival and medical expenses," Surbhi said.

64.title: Briton Watson enters Grand Slam singles 4th round in 43rd try at Wimbledon
64.article_body: World number 121 Heather Watson has entered the fourth round of a Grand Slam in singles for the first time in her career after a 7-6(8-6), 6-2 win over Slovenia's Kaja Juvan at Wimbledon 2022 on Friday. This is the Briton's 43rd Grand Slam tournament over 12 years. Meanwhile, third-seeded Ons Jabeur, the 2021 Wimbledon quarter-finalist, has reached fourth round.

65.title: 5 killed due to lightning in Bihar; CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
65.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar on Friday expressed grief after five people died due to lightning in three districts of the state. The CM further announced ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh for the family members of each of the deceased. He also requested people to take full vigil in bad weather and follow the suggestions issued by the Disaster Management Department.

66.title: Monkeypox cases in Europe have tripled in last 2 weeks: WHO
66.article_body: World Health Organization's (WHO) Europe chief Hans Kluge on Friday said that monkeypox cases in the region have tripled in the last two weeks. Kluge urged countries to do more to ensure the disease does not become entrenched on the continent. Over 5,000 monkeypox cases have been reported from 51 countries worldwide so far, according to a US health agency.

67.title: People must enjoy 'Ms Marvel': Farhan on the length of his role
67.article_body: Speaking about the short length of his role in 'Ms Marvel', actor Farhan Akhtar said that people must enjoy the show and Kamala's journey. Farhan added he's a part of the show due to Asian representation. His character sacrificed himself to protect Kamala. On being asked if his character is really dead, Farhan said, "I'm not allowed to answer it!"

68.title: Vijay Deverakonda meets fan who tattooed his pic, sign on her back
68.article_body: Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda recently met a female fan who got a portrait of his face as well as his signature tattooed on her back along with a heart. The video which has gone viral on social media shows the fan interacting with the actor and breaking down. Vijay can then be seen hugging and consoling her during their interaction.

69.title: Virat Kohli's reaction after getting out for 11(19) in 5th Test against England goes viral
69.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli was dismissed for 11 runs off 19 deliveries in the first innings of the rescheduled fifth Test against England on Friday. A video of Kohli's reaction after getting bowled has gone viral. In the video, Kohli can be seen smiling before making his way back to the pavilion. Kohli was dismissed by Matthew Potts.

70.title: Sudhir Chaudhary resigns as Zee News CEO, will start own enterprise
70.article_body: Zee News Editor-in-Chief and CEO Sudhir Chaudhary has resigned from his position. In his resignation letter addressed to Essel Group chairman Subhash Chandra, Chaudhary said his decision was a "result of his internal deliberations" to "start his own enterprise". He also sought blessings from Chandra while parting ways with the company "with heavy heart".

71.title: Steve Jobs, Simone Biles, 15 others to receive US' highest civilian honour
71.article_body: US President Joe Biden has announced 17 recipients of the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the US' highest civilian honour. The award will be presented to Apple's late Co-founder Steve Jobs, four-time Olympic gold medallist Simone Biles, actor Denzel Washington, and Olympic gold medalist soccer player Megan Rapinoe. "These...Americans demonstrate the power of possibilities," the White House said.

72.title: Opening a new chapter in ties with France: Aus after submarine row
72.article_body: During a visit to Paris, Australian PM Anthony Albanese said that Australia and France are opening up a new chapter in their relationship. This comes after tensions between the two countries rose briefly following Australia's cancellation of a deal to buy French-made submarines. "He's not responsible for what happened...We'll speak about the future, not the past," the French President said.

73.title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari's convoy hit by speeding truck
73.article_body: West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari on Friday said that a heavy vehicle rammed into a Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) escort car of his convoy. "By the grace of Lord Jagannath, nobody was hurt. I am not injured and will continue attending scheduled events. I am grateful for the innumerous calls enquiring about my well-being," Adhikari added.

74.title: We'll do good job as Opp'n, win back people's trust: Maha NCP chief
74.article_body: Maharashtra NCP chief Jayant Patil said that his party will do a good job as the Opposition and win back people's trust. The three parties of Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) will nominate a common candidate for the Assembly Speaker's post, he added. Speaking about ED summons to Sanjay Raut, he said, "He's innocent and we have no doubt about it."

75.title: 2 workers die while cleaning septic tank in Chennai, 2 arrested
75.article_body: Two workers cleaning a septic tank inside a gated community in Chennai's Perungudi died after inhaling poisonous gas on Wednesday evening. The police have arrested the building secretary who's an ex-serviceman and the supervisor in the case. The workers P Periyasamy and D Dhatchanamoorthy, both 38 years old, had been doing such work for the past five years, police said.

76.title: List shows 36 cricketers who have captained India in Test cricket
76.article_body: Jasprit Bumrah on Friday became the 36th cricketer to captain India in Test cricket. As many as 303 players have represented the country in Tests, with 36 of them going on to lead the nation. Cottari Kanakaiya Nayudu was the first captain of Indian Test team. Meanwhile, Virat Kohli holds the record for captaining India in most Tests (68).

77.title: Remove all content justifying Udaipur man's killing: Govt to social media platforms
77.article_body: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology has directed social media platforms to immediately remove all content that "seem to encourage/glorify/justify" the beheading of Udaipur man Kanhaiya Lal. This is to prevent any incitement and disruption of public order and to restore public peace and harmony, the Ministry said. Meta said it has designated the incident as "violating".

78.title: I thought he'd get to T20 WC 2022: Buttler on Morgan's retirement
78.article_body: Commenting on ex-England limited-overs captain Eoin Morgan's retirement from international cricket, Jos Buttler said he thought Morgan would play T20 World Cup 2022. "Thought that was what he was working towards, but he's always said...if he felt like the time came and he obviously said that that came in Amsterdam," he added. Buttler was appointed as England's new white-ball skipper.

79.title: Udaipur incident shows Taliban mentality: Haryana Home Minister
79.article_body: Haryana's Home Minister Anil Vij has said that Kanhaiya Lal's killing shows a "Taliban mentality" and that it needs to be eradicated from India. He added, "We'll take all necessary steps to tackle such a mentality." Two more people have been arrested in connection with the case for their alleged involvement in hatching the conspiracy, IG Udaipur said on Friday.

80.title: Punjab households to get 300 units of free electricity from today: CM Mann
80.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said households across the state will get 300 units of free electricity each month from today. "This means that people will get zero amount bills. All electricity bills prior to December 31, 2021 will be waived off," Mann further said. AAP chief and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while congratulating Punjab's citizens, said, "We've fulfilled our promise."

81.title: 'Fluffy' crab that wears a sponge as a hat discovered in Australia, pics released
81.article_body: A new species of crabs, with its body covered in fluff and hair, was discovered off the coast of Western Australia. The species, Lamarckdromia beagle, belongs to the Dromiidae family, commonly known as sponge crabs. Crustaceans in this family fashion and use sea sponges and ascidians for protection. They trim the creatures using their claws and wear them like hats.

82.title: India calls on Pak to release 536 Indian fishermen & 3 civilians
82.article_body: India on Friday called on Pakistan to release and repatriate 536 Indian fishermen and three civilian prisoners. India made the demand as the two countries exchanged lists of fishermen and prisoners today under an agreement. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) handed over a list of 309 Pakistani civilian prisoners and 95 fishermen in India's custody to Pakistan.

83.title: Who is SC Justice Surya Kant, who criticised Nupur Sharma for remarks on Prophet?
83.article_body: Supreme Court Justice Surya Kant, who severely criticised Nupur Sharma's remarks on Prophet, was elevated to the apex court in May 2019. He started his law practice in Haryana in 1984 and was appointed as the youngest Advocate General of Haryana in July 2000. Kant is on the bench for important cases like Article 370, Pegasus spyware, CAA etc.

84.title: Over 10 injured as roof of cabin collapses on Guj Rath Yatra route
84.article_body: Around 10-15 people sustained injuries when the roof of a cabin they were sitting on caved in on the route of Jagannath Rath Yatra in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Friday. Minister of State for Home Harsh Sanghavi was reportedly walking along with the procession when the incident took place. "Policemen rushed to the spot and helped all of them," Sanghavi said.

85.title: Raj Thackeray hails Fadnavis for accepting Maha's Deputy CM's post
85.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Friday congratulated Devendra Fadnavis on becoming Maharashtra's Deputy CM. "Everyone thought...you'll become CM, but sometimes one has to accept party's instructions," he wrote in a letter to Fadnavis. "Party's order is greater than anyone's ambition, you have shown it from your actions. This should be remembered by every political party worker and leader," he added.

86.title: We need to work on partnerships: Harmanpreet on India Women's 1st ODI win
86.article_body: Following India Women's four-wicket win against Sri Lanka Women in first ODI, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said the team needs to work on partnerships. Harmanpreet Kaur(44) and Harleen Deol(34) added a 62-run partnership for the fourth wicket. Deepti(22*) put on an unbeaten 38-run seventh-wicket stand with Pooja Vastrakar(21*) to help chase the 172-run target with 12 overs to spare.

87.title: Maoist carrying ₹5 lakh reward killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh
87.article_body: Police said that a Maoist carrying a reward of ₹5 lakh on his head was killed in an encounter with jawans of the District Reserve Guard (DRG) in Chhattisgarh's Sukma on Friday. "After the encounter ended, we recovered the body of a male Maoist...initially identified as Kamlesh, Malenger Area Committee Member," Sundarraj P, IG Bastar range, said.

88.title: England announce squads for their T20I and ODI series against India
88.article_body: England have announced their squads for the upcoming T20I and ODI series against India. The T20I and ODI series will be the first for Jos Buttler as England's full-time white-ball captain. Lancashire's 34-year-old fast bowler Richard Gleeson has earned his first full England call-up for the T20I series. Ex-England captain Joe Root has been included in the ODI squad.

89.title: Former DE Shaw partner fired for sexual misconduct wins record $52 million in US
89.article_body: A former partner at American hedge fund DE Shaw, who was fired at the start of the #MeToo movement in 2018, has been awarded record $52 million by an arbitration panel in the US. Daniel Michalow had filed a defamation complaint against DE Shaw seeking $600 million in damages. The panel also found that Michalow "did not commit sexual misconduct".

90.title: Received death threat from Sidhu Moosewala's murderers: Manu Punjabi
90.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 10' contestant Manu Punjabi has claimed that he received a death threat from the gang that murdered Punjabi singer and Congress leader Sidhu Moosewala. He took to Twitter to thank Jaipur Police for giving him security and catching hold of the culprit who sent him the email demanding ₹10 lakh. Manu also posted a screenshot of the email.

91.title: 1 in 5 houses in Bengal faced food crisis during lockdown: Report
91.article_body: A report released by Nobel laureate Amartya Sen-led Pratichi (India) Trust said that at least one in every five households in West Bengal faced "some food crisis" during the lockdown period in the first wave of COVID-19. "A majority of these households suffered for about 60 days," it added. Over 2,000 households had participated in the survey, the report mentioned.

92.title: Over 50 hurt as KSRTC, pvt bus crash against each other in K'taka
92.article_body: More than 50 passengers were left injured after a private bus and a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus crashed against each other on the Shivamogga-Sringeri road. As per reports, there were more than 35 passengers on the private bus and over 45 passengers on the KSRTC bus.

93.title: 5 terrorists arrested in Srinagar & Sopore, arms cache recovered
93.article_body: A hybrid terrorist was arrested on Thursday in Srinagar with a pistol, police said. Upon interrogating him, another hybrid terrorist was nabbed from Pampore with three pistols, police added. A grenade, bullets, gelatin sticks and detonators were also recovered from the duo, as per police. In Sopore, police said three terrorists were intercepted with an assault rifle, grenade and pistols.

94.title: I am the one who started the pan-India films trend: Madhavan
94.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has stated that he is the one who started the trend of pan-India films, adding that the rest of the world is catching up to him. "'Ramji Londonwaley' or '13B', which was one of the first films to be shot simultaneously, 'Rocketry' has the distinction of being shot in three languages, forget about two," the actor added.

95.title: A nothing shot: Shastri on Gill's dismissal at 17 in 5th Test vs England
95.article_body: Reacting to Shubman Gill's dismissal at 17 in fifth Test against England in Edgbaston, Ravi Shastri said it's unfortunate and the India opener needed to bring discipline into his game. On a James Anderson delivery, Gill was caught by Zak Crawley at the second slip. "That's a nothing shot...he'll be disappointed with it. This is a boundary-scoring ground," he added.

96.title: Taking extra care: Nadal after 3 players pulled out of Wimbledon due to COVID
96.article_body: Second seed Rafael Nadal said he is taking extra precautions and not doing many things after three COVID positive men's singles players withdrew from Wimbledon 2022. "Just staying here and staying in the house, not going out at all anymore," he added. Nadal, who won his 22nd Grand Slam last month, entered the third round on Thursday.

97.title: Rahul visits vandalised Wayanad office, calls act 'unfortunate'
97.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Friday visited his office in Kerala's Wayanad, which was allegedly vandalised by CPI(M)'s student wing Students' Federation of India (SFI) last week. Gandhi said, "It's unfortunate what happened. Violence never resolves problems." "I don't have any anger or hostility towards them. They are kids and they don't understand the consequences of their act," he added.

98.title: 78-yr-old woman told to pay ₹25,000/month alimony to 83-yr-old ex-husband in Pune
98.article_body: A Pune family court told a 78-year-old woman to pay interim alimony of ₹25,000 per month to her 83-year-old estranged husband. The husband had filed for divorce from his wife of 55 years in 2019 and sought alimony alleging that he was repeatedly harassed by her. The couple also reportedly accused each other of having extramarital affairs.

99.title: HDFC yet to recover funds after sending ₹1,000 cr to some accounts due to glitch: Report
99.article_body: HDFC Bank is still attempting to recover funds from some customers in Tamil Nadu after it mistakenly transferred ₹1,000 crore into their accounts in May, BQ Prime reported. About ₹35-40 crore continues to remain with customers, the report said. The transfer of funds was caused due to a technical glitch, following which HDFC briefly froze many of these bank accounts.

100.title: US fails to secure release of Americans imprisoned in Venezuela
100.article_body: A delegation led by US Special Envoy for Hostage Affairs, Roger Carstens, on Thursday failed to secure the release of American citizens imprisoned in Venezuela, US officials informed. "The trip focused on...wrongfully detained U.S. nationals in Venezuela and to press for their release," the State Department stated. The department added that Carstens met the detainees to "assess their well-being".

101.title: What is earthshine, the phenomenon that will make the Moon glow this weekend?
101.article_body: A new Moon occurs when all of Sun's light is reflected away from Earth, and the side of Moon facing Earth is barely visible. Sometimes the dark face of Moon catches Earth's reflected glow and returns that light. This phenomenon is called earthshine. The earthshine Moon will be visible for next few days but will be brightest over the weekend.

102.title: 14 mobile forensic labs launched by Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin
102.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin launched 14 mobile forensic labs in Chennai to facilitate preliminary examination at the scene of the crime. The mobile vans have been custom-built at an estimated cost of ₹3.92 crore. Stalin also lauded the Forensic Sciences Department for getting the National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories international certification for its main lab.

103.title: Congrats on car, but tomorrow isn't 'kol': Anirban criticises Kartik's Bengali
103.article_body: Actor Anirban Bhattacharya recently criticised actor Kartik Aaryan's Bengali accent in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' on social media. He tweeted, "Congratulations [on] your new car/Chinese food table. Just remember 'tomorrow' is not 'kol' or 'call' in bangla. It's 'kaal'." Kartik was recently gifted a McLaren GT worth ₹3.73 crore by 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' producer Bhushan Kumar following the film's success.

104.title: 60-yr-old Mysore University staffer found dead on day of retirement
104.article_body: A 60-year-old employee of the University of Mysore in Karnataka was found dead with his throat slit on the day of his retirement, police said. "We are investigating the case and so far, we have no information on the killers," DCP (Crime) Geetha Prasanna said. The deceased was a resident of Kanakagiri in the city, police added.

105.title: Sidhu Moosewala, Lata Mangeshkar among top 5 most Googled Asians
105.article_body: Google has released its list of most searched Asians worldwide which features late singers Sidhu Moosewala and Lata Mangeshkar at the third and fifth spots respectively. Actresses Katrina Kaif, Alia Bhatt and Priyanka Chopra are seventh, eighth and ninth on the list. Virat Kohli is in the tenth spot and Salman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan are eleventh and twelfth.

106.title: 30,260 kg of spurious cumin seized from a godown in Gujarat's Unjha
106.article_body: The Food and Drugs Control Administration (FDCA) seized 30,260 kg of spurious cumin seeds and raw materials from a godown in Gujarat's Unjha. "The accused used to mix the spurious cumin with the real one...to prevent customers from detecting the presence of the spurious material," FDCA Commissioner said. Unjha is the biggest market and exporting centre for spices.

107.title: Odisha CM Patnaik pulls chariot during Jagannath Rath Yatra in Puri
107.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik participated in the Jagannath Rath Yatra in Puri on Friday. He was also seen pulling the chariot, along with Governor Ganeshi Lal and Union minister Dharmendra Pradhan. CM Patnaik also introduced the Srimandir Heritage Corridor project to curb challenges during the Rath Yatra, according to officials.

108.title: Nadal is one of the greatest players, he always intimidates me: Gauff
108.article_body: World number 12 Coco Gauff has said 22-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal's words mean a lot to her. "Rafa is one of the greatest in this sport, if not the greatest. I see him in...players' area, he's very nice. He always intimidates me because he is Rafa," she added. Meanwhile, the 18-year-old entered Wimbledon 2022 third round on Thursday.

109.title: Kate Winslet's 1st look from Avatar 2 revealed, pic goes viral
109.article_body: Kate Winslet's look as Ronal was exclusively revealed on the cover of the Empire magazine's special Avatar edition. 'Avatar: The Way of Water', the sequel to 'Avatar', has been directed by James Cameron. Speaking about her character, Kate told Empire, "She is deeply loyal and a fearless leader." The film is scheduled to arrive in theatres on December 16, 2022

110.title: Man shares pic of ₹70 bill for 1 tea on Shatabdi Express, officials explain charges
110.article_body: A Shatabdi Express passenger shared a picture of a bill charging him ₹70 (₹20 + ₹50 GST) for a single cup of tea on the train. Railway officials, however, explained that as per a 2018 order, passengers of Rajdhani/Shatabdi/Duronto trains who don't book meals while reserving seats will have to pay a ₹50 service charge per meal.

111.title: It's like all mess went loose: Urmila on judgment over entering politics
111.article_body: Actress Urmila Matondkar spoke about the judgment she faced on entering politics, saying, "It was like all the mess went loose, everything went baloney." She added that being known as a sex symbol, she was expected to be dumb and clueless. Urmila further said the joke was on the journalists who flew down to Mumbai to film her political campaign.

112.title: Bengaluru to have amenities of international standards: K'taka CM
112.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said, "We have resolved to develop Bengaluru into a city with amenities of international standards and we are committed to make it a reality." "Our government is committed for the comprehensive development of Bengaluru," he added. Bommai blamed the present civic woes of the city on the previous governments.

113.title: Monsoon Session of Parliament to start from July 18
113.article_body: The Monsoon Session of Parliament will begin on July 18 and conclude on August 12, according to a press release by the Lok Sabha Secretariat. The session will have 18 sittings, the secretariat said. Notably, the session usually commences in the third week of July and concludes ahead of Independence Day, according to a report.

114.title: Have 170 MLAs' support, number increasing: Maha CM Shinde ahead of floor test
114.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Friday said that the new state government, formed in alliance with the BJP, has the support of 170 MLAs. "The number is increasing. We have a comfortable majority in the Assembly," Shinde added. State Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has asked Shinde to prove a majority in the Assembly on July 4.

115.title: I would've supported Droupadi Murmu had BJP informed earlier: WB CM
115.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that she could've considered Droupadi Murmu, the NDA's Presidential candidate, as the consensus candidate had the BJP consulted her over the nomination. "If...BJP had informed us...that they were backing a tribal lady as the Presidential candidate, then we would've supported her," she said. "Murmu is more likely to win the polls," she added.

116.title: WhatsApp banned over 19 lakh Indian accounts in May
116.article_body: WhatsApp banned 19.1 lakh Indian accounts in May 2022, the Meta-owned messaging platform said in its monthly report under the Information Technology (Intermediary Guidelines and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021. Between May 1 and May 31, WhatsApp received 528 grievance reports, out of which 303 reports were for ban appeal. It took remedial action against 24 of these reports.

117.title: Mumbai history-sheeter arrested with drugs worth ₹23.5 lakh
117.article_body: The Anti-Narcotics Cell of the Mumbai Police on Wednesday arrested a 32-year-old history-sheeter, Nasir Qureshi and recovered 156 grams of mephedrone worth ₹23.50 lakh. He was arrested during a routine patrol in Kurla. "It's a commercial quantity and hence Qureshi was placed under arrest and charged under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act," an ANC officer said.

118.title: 68 more pelican traffic signals set up to make road crossings safer in Hyd
118.article_body: To allow pedestrians to cross roads safely, the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has set up 68 pelican traffic signals on intersection points near schools, colleges and hospitals. These signals are manually-controlled and pedestrians can get 15 seconds to cross the road by pressing a button on them. GHMC is planning to set up 26 more pelican signals in Hyderabad.

119.title: Vidyut climbs down scaffolding for selfie with construction worker
119.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal on Friday shared a video on Instagram interacting with a construction worker from a balcony who said he is a fan of the actor. Vidyut can be seen praising the worker, saying he does more stunts every day than actors do in films. He then climbed down the scaffolding to click a selfie with the worker.

120.title: India Women defeat SL Women in Harmanpreet's 1st ODI as full-time captain
120.article_body: India Women defeated Sri Lanka Women by four wickets in first ODI in Pallekele on Friday. It was Harmanpreet Kaur's first match as full-time India ODI skipper. Chasing 172, India scored 176/6 in 38 overs, with Harmanpreet top-scoring with 44(63). All-rounder Deepti Sharma scored 22* and took three wickets, while other all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar hit 21* and scalped two wickets.

121.title: Which startups are likely to become unicorns in next 2 years as per Hurun?
121.article_body: Hurun India's 'ASK Private Wealth Hurun India Future Unicorn Index 2022' has identified 51 'gazelles', or startups founded after 2000 that have the potential to become a unicorn in the next two years. Among these, Shiprocket is the most valuable startup, followed by Zepto and Turtlemint. The list also includes startups such as Ather Energy, Ninjacart, Dunzo, Rapido, ClearTax, Gaana.

122.title: Thane man gets 6 yrs in jail for sexually assaulting 9-yr-old girl
122.article_body: A special court in Thane sentenced a man, Ganesh, to six years of rigorous imprisonment for sexually assaulting a nine-year-old girl. The court also imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on him. The incident took place in May 2015, when the girl was playing outside and Ganesh took her to an isolated place and sexually assaulted her, special public prosecutor said.

123.title: Rachakonda Police arrest burglar, gold & cash worth ₹4.6 lakh seized
123.article_body: The Rachakonda Police arrested a 37-year-old habitual inter-state house burglar, identified as Brahmadevi Raja Ganesh alias Rajaiah from his residence in Khairatabad and recovered ₹1 lakh cash from him. The police also seized three tolas of gold ornaments, 22 tolas of silver, two motorcycles and eight mobile phones worth a total of ₹4.65 lakh from him.

124.title: International Criminal Court marks 20th anniversary of establishment
124.article_body: The International Criminal Court (ICC) marked the 20th anniversary of its establishment on Friday. Currently, the ICC has investigations underway in 17 countries, with a majority of them being in Africa. A total of 123 countries are members of the court and accept its jurisdiction, but countries like the US, Russia and China do not.

125.title: Sindhu, Prannoy crash out of Malaysia Open 2022, lose in quarters
125.article_body: Indian shuttler PV Sindhu crashed out in the women's singles quarter-final at Malaysia Open 2022 after losing to second seeded Tai Tzu Ying on Friday. Sindhu, seeded seventh, lost 21-13, 15-21, 13-21 in 53 minutes. In the men's singles quarter-final, seventh seeded Jonatan Christie beat India's HS Prannoy 21-18, 21-16. With this the Indian campaign has ended.

126.title: I'm just trying to take the complexities out of batting: Bairstow
126.article_body: Talking about his aggressive style of play, England batter Jonny Bairstow said, "I'm trying to remain as clear as possible...have no doubts about my ability or the way I'm going about my batting." He added, "I'm just trying to take the complexities out of batting." Bairstow slammed the second-fastest century and fifty for England in Tests against New Zealand recently.

127.title: Will support NDA's Prez candidate Murmu: Shiromani Akali Dal chief
127.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal on Friday said, "We have decided to support National Democratic Alliance's (NDA) Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu." "We will never go with Congress because of the atrocities they have committed on the Sikh community," he further said. "Akali Dal has always supported people from marginalised sections of society," Badal added.

128.title: Plea seeking withdrawal of SC Justice's remarks on Nupur Sharma filed before CJI
128.article_body: A letter petition has been filed before the Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana, which seeks the withdrawal of Justice Surya Kant's observations on suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. Gau Mahasabha leader Ajay Gautam said that Justice Kant's remarks on Sharma should be declared "uncalled for". Justice Kant held Sharma "single-handedly responsible for what is happening in the country".

129.title: You're not just Nupur's PM, how long you'll save her: Owaisi to PM
129.article_body: After the Supreme Court criticised suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma for her comments on Prophet Muhammad, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioned, "Will [PM Narendra Modi] issue a statement or not?" "You're not just Nupur's PM. You're the PM of the 133 crore-strong India which has nearly 20 crore Muslims. How long will you save her?" he further asked PM Modi.

130.title: 2 more arrested for Kanhaiya Lal's killing, were involved in preparation for crime
130.article_body: Police said that two more men have been arrested in connection to the beheading of Udaipur man Kanhaiya Lal who had supported Nupur Sharma on social media. "They were involved in the conspiracy and preparation behind the entire crime," said Udaipur IG Prafulla Kumar. The two main accused Riyaz Akhtari and Gaus Mohammad were arrested earlier.

131.title: What's included & what's not as 1% TDS on virtual digital assets comes into effect?
131.article_body: The rules governing the imposition of 1% TDS on the transfer of virtual digital assets (VDAs) of more than ₹10,000 has come into effect from today. All cryptocurrencies and NFTs, except tangible asset-backed NFTs, will be subject to TDS deduction. Further, the government has clarified that gift cards or vouchers, mileage points, reward points, and website subscriptions are not VDAs.

132.title: 16 dead so far in Manipur landslide, rescue op for over 50 underway
132.article_body: The death toll due to a landslide, which hit Tupul railway station in Manipur's Noney district, increased to 16 on Friday. "We hope to complete the search and rescue operations within two to three days. The soil is so soft that hardly any movement is possible," CM N Biren Singh said. Search operations are reportedly underway for over 50 people.

133.title: Cameron Diaz to make comeback with Netflix film 'Back In Action'
133.article_body: Actress Cameron Diaz will be making her comeback alongside actor Jamie Foxx in Netflix's upcoming film 'Back In Action'. Notably, the two actors have earlier worked together in 'Any Given Sunday' (1999) and the 'Annie' remake, which released in 2014. 'Back In Action' will be directed by Seth Gordon and the shoot is expected to begin later this year.

134.title: Van Nistelrooy said 'He should be in circus' when Ronaldo didn't pass: Rio
134.article_body: Sharing an anecdote from his stint as a Manchester United player alongside Cristiano Ronaldo, Rio Ferdinand said, "Ronaldo had the ball wide and was doing tricks...[while] Ruud van Nistelrooy was making the run in the box." "Ronaldo didn't pass and Ruud went crazy, screaming...'He should be in the circus'...Ronaldo got...angry - 'Why's he talking to me like that?'" added Rio.

135.title: Miscreants stalking girl for several days chop off her nose in UP
135.article_body: Miscreants allegedly chopped off a minor girl's nose for resisting rape on Thursday in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur Dehat district, a report said. The miscreants, who barged into the girl's residence and tried to drag her away with them, attacked her with a sharp weapon when she tried to raise an alert. They were reportedly following the girl for many days.

136.title: DRDO carries out maiden flight of unmanned fighter aircraft in K'taka
136.article_body: The Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) on Friday successfully carried out the inaugural flight of the Autonomous Flying Wing Technology Demonstrator from the Aeronautical Test Range in Karnataka's Chitradurga. "This flight marks a major milestone, in terms of proving critical technologies towards the development of future unmanned aircraft," an official statement said.

137.title: Chances of reviving nuclear deal worse after talks with Iran: US Official
137.article_body: A senior US official on Thursday said that the chances of reviving the 2015 Iran nuclear deal are worse after indirect US-Iranian talks in Qatar ended without progress. The official claimed that Iran had made vague demands, reopened settled issues and made requests unrelated to the deal during the talks. The talks were mediated by the European Union (EU).

138.title: Will try to balance films with emotions, but can't do away with action: Vidyut
138.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal has said that he is trying to balance his films with emotions while doing action. Vidyut said that he would love to play different roles as there are a number of emotions that "we as human beings feel". "But since audiences like to see me doing action more...I just can't disappoint them either," the actor added.

139.title: Cong' Genuine Simple Tax turned into Gabbar Singh Tax by BJP: Rahul
139.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP-led Centre on the fifth anniversary of the implementation of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) across India. "Congress' Genuine Simple Tax was turned into Gabbar Singh Tax by BJP...It's a nightmare to do business, especially for MSMEs. Congress will revive business and jobs with GST 2.0," Rahul said.

140.title: We've shown very small part of Nambi's torture in 'Rocketry...': Madhavan
140.article_body: Actor-director R Madhavan has said his film, 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', would have become too dark and morbid if he had shown everything that former ISRO scientist Nambi Narayanan went through. "We've actually shown a very small part of his torture and interrogation," he added. Nambi was wrongly accused in 1994 of leaking defence secrets.

141.title: I was paid well but had nothing to do: Upasana on quitting Kapil Sharma Show
141.article_body: Speaking about quitting 'The Kapil Sharma Show', actress Upasana Singh said that she was being paid well but felt like she had nothing to do anymore. "I told Kapil that I'm no longer being challenged. I asked him to either give me the kind of roles that I had when we started or to let me go," the actress added.

142.title: Steve Smith did look annoyed: Khawaja on run-out in 1st Test vs SL
142.article_body: Talking about Steve Smith's run-out in Australia's first innings of the opening Test against Sri Lanka following a mix-up with him, batter Usman Khawaja said, "He did look annoyed." "Looking [into] the past...does not help anyone," added Khawaja. Discussing about the pitch, Khawaja stated, "I was just laughing because of what the balls were doing, everything...was quite funny."

143.title: It wouldn't be right move for Man Utd to let go of Ronaldo: Ex-player
143.article_body: Former Manchester United player Louis Saha has said that it wouldn't be the "right move" for the English football club to let forward Cristiano Ronaldo go from their side. "It could go both ways, no one can guarantee anything apart from Cristiano...It wouldn't be the right move to let Ronaldo go because he's such a big asset," Saha said.

144.title: Netflix briefly crashes after new 'Stranger Things' episodes released, people react
144.article_body: Netflix briefly went down for many users, after a large number of subscribers logged on to stream the new episodes of Stranger Things. Subscribers were greeted by a 'Network Error' message. "I didn't just count down...seconds like it's New Years for Netflix to crash #StrangerThings," a tweet read. "It's been...5 minutes how did we crash Netflix already," another person tweeted.

145.title: Bumrah corrects Butcher's 'Fast bowler has never captained India' remark, video viral
145.article_body: Jasprit Bumrah, who is leading India in the rescheduled fifth Test against England, corrected ex-England cricketer Mark Butcher during the toss after he said that a fast bowler has never captained India. "Well, it has happened before, Kapil Dev was the captain," Bumrah said to which Butcher said, "[He was] all-rounder." Bumrah then replied, "Alright...all-rounder if you say so."

146.title: 'RRR' nominated for Best Picture at Hollywood Critics Association Awards
146.article_body: SS Rajamouli's directorial 'RRR', starring Jr NTR and Ram Charan, has become the first Indian film to get nominated for Best Picture at Hollywood Critics Association (HCA) Awards. The film will be competing with Tom Cruise-starrer 'Top Gun: Maverick', 'Elvis' featuring Austin Butler, Robert Pattinson's 'The Batman' and others. The winners of HCA will be announced on July 1.

147.title: Happy that I got to act in Dunki on merit, not any recommendation: Taapsee
147.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, while talking about featuring opposite Shah Rukh Khan in 'Dunki', said she feels happy to have bagged the role on the basis of merit. "Nobody picked up the phone for a recommendation. I got the film only because someone liked what I did," Taapsee added. Helmed by Rajkumar Hirani, 'Dunki' is expected to release in December 2023.

148.title: Great gift to planet: Denmark envoy as India bans single-use plastic
148.article_body: Freddy Svane, Denmark's Ambassador to India, on Friday congratulated India for banning single-use plastic items in the country. He said, "I think it's a great idea. India is moving fast. And what India contributes by banning single-use plastic is a great gift to this planet." Notably, the ban on single-use plastic items in India has come into effect from today.

149.title: PM Modi speaks with Putin, reiterates call for dialogue on Ukraine conflict
149.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin on the phone, the Prime Minister's office said. "In the context of the ongoing situation in Ukraine, PM reiterated India's long-standing position in favour of dialogue and diplomacy," said the PMO. The two leaders exchanged ideas on increasing bilateral trade in agricultural goods, fertilizers and pharma products, it added.

150.title: Don't toy with Mumbai's environment: Uddhav on Shinde govt's Aarey shed plan
150.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said he is saddened by the Eknath Shinde-led government's move to relocate Metro 3 car shed to Mumbai's Aarey Milk colony. "Don't toy with the environment of Mumbai," the former CM added. "Don't project anger for me on Mumbaikars. Don't change the proposal for the metro shed," Thackeray further said.

151.title: He doesn't define me anymore: Kubbra on being sexually abused at 17
151.article_body: Actress Kubbra Sait has stated that she did not write about being sexually abused at the age of 17 by a family friend for an apology from him. "I was not writing to showcase a monster...I am over it. He does not define me anymore," she added. The actress further said she is looking at it from an outsider's perspective.

152.title: Semi-automated offside technology approved for WC 2022: FIFA
152.article_body: Football's apex body, FIFA, has approved the use of semi-automated offside technology for this year's FIFA World Cup in Qatar. The technology aims to make more accurate and a lot quicker decisions, and will be able to resolve contentious offside calls, officials said. Notably, the technology will be assisted with strategically positioned cameras and a chip in the match ball.

153.title: Russia arrests scientist for working with Chinese secret services
153.article_body: Russia has detained a scientist in Serbia on charges of high treason for allegedly collaborating with Chinese security services, the Russian state news agency TASS reported on Friday. Dmitry Kolker has now been moved to a prison in Moscow, TASS quoted Kolker's son as saying. The scientist faces up to 20 years in jail if convicted.

154.title: Neeraj Chopra touches elderly fan's feet after breaking national record, video goes viral
154.article_body: A video has gone viral showing India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra touching an elderly fan's feet after breaking his own national record at Stockholm Diamond League. In the video, the 24-year-old was seen interacting with fans and before leaving, he touched an elderly fan's feet. One of the fans was heard saying, "So down to earth."

155.title: We were pretty scared, Shastri wasn't able to talk properly: Ishant on COVID-19 outbreak
155.article_body: Talking about COVID-19 outbreak hitting Team India during the Test series against England last year, Ishant Sharma said, "We all were pretty scared during that time." He added, "During the Oval Test...Ravi bhai was in the dressing room and he was not able to talk properly." Ishant stated, "There was his book launch and we thought he had caught cold."

156.title: If SRK had done KGF, audience would have never accepted it: Raj Saluja
156.article_body: Actor-writer Raj Saluja, when asked about the rise of pan-India movies and if Bollywood is going wrong somewhere, said, "It's...audience that decides whom to accept and whom not to accept." "If you put, Shah Rukh in KGF, they'll not accept...[he] can do this. But if Yash is doing it, you're accepting...Why? Because...audience is...accepting...South actors can do...any damn thing," he added.

157.title: Fake call centre busted in Gurugram, 9 held over extorting money
157.article_body: Police on Thursday busted a fake call centre operating from a building in Gurugram's DLF Phase 2 and arrested nine people for allegedly extorting money from foreign nationals after posing as federal police officials. "The accused threatened to suspend the 'national identity number' of potential victims," police said. "They forced them to purchase gift cards of several companies," police added.

158.title: PM Modi congratulates Yair Lapid for assuming Premiership of Israel
158.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday congratulated Yair Lapid for assuming the Premiership of Israel. "I look forward to continue furthering our strategic partnership as we celebrate 30 years of full diplomatic relations," PM Modi tweeted. Lapid took over as caretaker PM after the Israeli Parliament voted to dissolve itself on Thursday, setting the stage for a fresh election in November.

159.title: I had an abortion after a one-night stand when I was 30: Actress Kubbra Sait
159.article_body: Actress Kubbra Sait has revealed she had an abortion after a one-night stand when she was 30. She recalled her trip to Andaman in 2013 when she got physically close with a friend and got pregnant. "I don't think I'm still ready. I don't understand this pressure around women to...[marry]...at 23 and have children by...30," she said in an interview.

160.title: Rupee relatively better placed than other global currencies against US dollar: FM
160.article_body: Amid a declining rupee against the US dollar, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the Indian currency is relatively better placed than other global currencies against the US dollar. Sitharaman said that she is "watchful and mindful" of the impact of the falling rupee and added, "We aren't alone in this world...developments happening everywhere will have an impact on us."

161.title: Russia scraps all COVID-19 restrictions amid declining cases
161.article_body: Russia on Friday said it was ending all COVID-19 restrictions, including the requirement to wear face masks, amid declining virus cases in the country. Russia's consumer protection watchdog, Rospotrebnadzor, claimed that 93% of currently confirmed cases are either mild or asymptomatic. The country has reported more than 1.8 crore COVID-19 cases and over 3.7 lakh coronavirus-related deaths so far.

162.title: Ukraine calls Russia a 'terrorist country' as 19 including 2 kids killed in missile strike
162.article_body: Russian missile attacks on residential areas in a coastal town near the Ukrainian port city of Odesa killed at least 19 people including two kids. Andriy Yermak, the chief of staff to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "A terrorist country is killing our people. In response to defeats on the battlefield, they fight civilians."

163.title: Pune authority demolishes illegal constructions located at Kesnand
163.article_body: Continuing its drive against illegal constructions, the Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) on Thursday demolished nine illegal constructions located at Kesnand with the help of five earth movers. According to a PMRDA official, the authority had issued notices to the owners of these properties before the demolition. PMRDA also urged citizens to not conduct illegal constructions.

164.title: ED arrests 2 aides of Delhi minister Satyendar Jain in money laundering case
164.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has arrested two associates of arrested Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain in an alleged money laundering case, ANI reported citing sources. The duo, identified as Ankush Jain and Vaibhav Jain, are directors of a Delhi-based jewellery firm and they'll be produced in a special ED court later. This comes a month after ED arrested Jain in the case.

165.title: India's space industry has potential to hit $40 bn: IN-SPACe Chairman
165.article_body: IN-SPACe Chairman Pawan Kumar Goenka has said that India's space industry has the potential to reach $40 billion, but investments are a "major challenge". "This is where Indian startups have a disadvantage compared to the US," he said. He also said India can be the global manufacturing hub of several space objects and even "launch satellites for other countries".

166.title: Truck hits e-rickshaw in UP's Sultanpur; 5 killed, 3 injured
166.article_body: An e-rickshaw was hit by a truck on the Prayagraj-Ayodhya bypass in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur district. The accident led to the death of five occupants of the e-rickshaw while three people are critically injured. Four out of the five deceased have been identified as Phool Kali (60), Rajendra (45), Raghuvir (55) and Nirmala (52), police said.

167.title: Blast reported inside civil court in Patna; 1 constable injured
167.article_body: A low-intensity blast was reported inside the civil court in Bihar's Patna on Friday. Patna SSP said a constable has sustained an injury in his right hand. According to police, the blast took place when gunpowder, which was recovered from a hostel in Patna University a few days ago, was taken to the court to seek permission for further investigation.

168.title: Directors now think of me for non-stereotypical roles: Mukti on 'Thar'
168.article_body: Actor and dancer Mukti Mohan, while talking about her recently released film 'Thar', said she is glad that she isn't getting the girl-next-door kind of roles. "Now, directors are thinking of me for roles that are non-stereotypical. It's a true blessing that people are noticing me and saying that I can act," she added. 'Thar' also stars Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor.

169.title: He's his own competition: Gautam on Neeraj breaking his national record again
169.article_body: Reacting to javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra winning a silver medal at Stockholm Diamond League after breaking his national record again, Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "This guy is unstoppable. He is his own competition!" Virender Sehwag said, "We will make, we will break...what a return from the champion." The 24-year-old threw 89.94 metres, breaking his previous national record of 89.30 metres.

170.title: Assam CM Sarma sues Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia for defamation over corruption claims
170.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has filed a defamation case against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia after the latter accused the former of "brazen corruption". Sisodia had alleged that the Assam government gave contracts to firms linked to Sarma's family to supply PPE kits at exorbitant prices. Sarma's wife Riniki has already filed a ₹100 crore defamation case against Sisodia.

171.title: TikTok users share credit card info of judges who reversed abortion ruling in US
171.article_body: Several TikTok users are sharing purported personal information such as the credit card details of the judges of the US Supreme Court who reversed the abortion ruling in Roe vs Wade. Such videos are being shared in form of slideshows of the justice's portraits along with the information. Other videos on TikTok allegedly included the home addresses of the judges.

172.title: It was incredible: Ms Marvel's Aramis Knight on working with Farhan Akhtar
