172.article_body: Actor Aramis Knight has said that working with Farhan Akhtar in Marvel Studios' 'Ms Marvel' was incredible. "Such a nice guy, so full of warmth. I was able to get quite a few pieces of advice from him that I will always cherish. And overall it was great," he added. Farhan plays a character named Waleed on the show.

173.title: Hero MotoCorp gets permit to use 'Hero' trademark for its EVs
173.article_body: A Delhi High Court-appointed arbitration panel has permitted Hero MotoCorp to manufacture and sell EVs under the trademark 'Hero'. It dismissed the application filed by Hero Electric for an interim injunction against Hero MotoCorp using the 'Hero' brand for EVs. The tribunal emphasised our ₹7,000-crore expenses on the brand building of Hero in the past 10 years, Hero MotoCorp said.

174.title: Was performing badly, Bhatt broke inhibitions publicly attacking me: Sushmita
174.article_body: Sushmita Sen recalled an incident between her and director Mahesh Bhatt on sets of her debut film 'Dastak'. She said she was performing the mahurat shot badly, adding, "[Mahesh]...broke inhibitions in front of 40 media people, 20 production guys, publicly attacking me." "I got...angry and started walking off...he grabbed my hand...and said, 'That's anger, give it (on camera)'," she added.

175.title: Ex-students of DU register for 'centenary chance' to get degrees
175.article_body: Over 8,000 former students of Delhi University have registered for the university's 'centenary chance' examinations, a second opportunity to complete their degrees. Ex-students who were in the final year of their UG, PG or professional courses will reportedly be considered for these examinations. The 'centenary chance' will be offered for theory and practical exams but not for internal assessment.

176.title: Picking Bumrah as captain can cause confusion: Giles on 5th Test
176.article_body: Ex-England spinner Ashley Giles said Jasprit Bumrah being picked as India's captain for the fifth rescheduled Test against England can cause "confusion" in Bumrah's mind regarding when and how much to bowl. "That is why we...don't see pacers captaining international teams in Test matches that much particularly in recent times," added Giles. Giles stated Bumrah is India's "most potent" bowler.

177.title: Pakistani drone airdrops 3.5 kg heroin in Punjab; recovered
177.article_body: Following a joint search operation, the police and BSF recovered 3.5 kg of heroin which was allegedly airdropped by a Pakistani drone in Ferozepur on Thursday. The BSF personnel had noticed the drone and fired at it, but it managed to return to Pakistan after dropping the material, the district SSP Charanjit Singh said. A case has been registered.

178.title: Police save 40-year-old man attempting to die by suicide in Delhi
178.article_body: Delhi Police personnel on Thursday saved a 40-year-old man who allegedly tried to end his life at his residence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, officials said. Police reached the spot after receiving information about a person attempting to hang himself, following which two policemen undid the noose from the ceiling fan and brought him down, a police officer added.

179.title: BJP should hang its head in shame: Cong MP on SC's remarks on Nupur
179.article_body: Supreme Court's remarks on suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's comments on Prophet should make BJP "hang its head in shame", a statement issued by Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said. "It's no secret that...BJP seeks to profit from inflaming communal passions," he added. The apex court had said that Sharma is "single-handedly responsible for what is happening in the country."

180.title: Save power: Japan to citizens after worst June heatwave since 1875
180.article_body: Amid rising temperatures, the Japanese government has asked citizens to reduce power use as much as possible, while running air conditioners to stay safe. The region around the Japanese capital Tokyo hit its seventh straight day of temperatures above 35 degrees Celsius on Friday. The June heat in Japan was the worst since record-keeping began in 1875.

181.title: Masterstroke of Devendra Fadnavis: Shinde on becoming Maha CM
181.article_body: Eknath Shinde, after taking oath as Maharashtra CM, said, "People thought that BJP was desperate for power. But truly, this is a masterstroke by Devendra [Fadnavis] ji." "To hand over power to another person despite having a larger number [of MLAs] requires a big heart," he added. "People...got to see a new example of this large heartedness," Shinde said.

182.title: Joe Root honoured with silver bat for completing 10,000 Test runs, ICC share pic
182.article_body: The ICC have shared a picture of former England captain Joe Root being presented with a silver bat to commemorate him for reaching 10,000 runs in Test cricket. Root reached the 10,000-run mark last month. He became the joint-youngest batter to reach the 10,000-run mark at the age of 31 years and 157 days, equalling Alastair Cook's record.

183.title: Portion of building collapses in Delhi's Paharganj, 30 rescued
183.article_body: A portion of a building in Delhi's Paharganj area collapsed on Thursday evening following which 30 people were rescued, police said. About eight to ten families, or at least thirty people, were inside the building at the time of the incident, police added. They were rescued without any injuries or deaths, or any loss of property, police further said.

184.title: Thailand scrambles jets after Myanmar's warplane enters Thai airspace
184.article_body: Thailand scrambled fighter jets near its border area on Thursday after a warplane from Myanmar violated the Thai airspace. The plane was carrying out attacks on ethnic minority rebels, a senior Thai official said. Though the incident may have appeared serious, it was "not a big deal", Thai PM Prayut Chan-o-cha said on Friday.

185.title: I will never confirm or deny: Kiara on rumours of dating Sidharth
185.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani reacted to the rumours of her relationship with actor Sidharth Malhotra, saying that people can assume what they want and she will never confirm or deny anything. "Although if you say something, it will be written about then as well so I feel that saying something won't make much of a difference," the actress added.

186.title: Why am I involved in this: Dakota on her video of 'noticing' Depp's finger
186.article_body: Actress Dakota Johnson reacted to her old video going viral during Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's defamation trial, saying, "I was like, 'Why am I involved in this...Don't let this go further.'" The video 'The EXACT moment Dakota Johnson KNEW Amber Heard was VIOLENT towards Johnny Depp' showed Dakota and Johnny talking about his injured finger during 'Black Mass' promotions.

187.title: Had Shah allowed Sena CM for 2.5 yrs in Maha, MVA wouldn't have been formed: Uddhav
187.article_body: After Shiv Sena rebel Eknath Shinde became CM of Maharashtra, former CM Uddhav Thackeray said, "I told Amit Shah earlier...that there should be a Shiv Sena CM for 2.5 years (during BJP-Sena alliance)." Thackeray said, "Had they done this earlier, there would've been no Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA or Sena-Congress-NCP alliance)." He added, "A BJP leader would've been CM today."

188.title: Apple hikes price of iPhones, iPads in Japan as yen's value tanks
188.article_body: Apple has hiked the price of its iPhones and iPads in Japan amid a dip in the value of yen. It has added as much as 25% to the cost of its mobile gadgets, increasing iPhone 13's starting price up to $869.58, compared to $736.71 previously. It has increased the price of its iPad and iPad Air by $73.82 each.

189.title: Bumrah just wanted to talk about Test cricket; he loves it: Jayawardena
189.article_body: Mumbai Indians coach Mahela Jayawardena has said that India's interim-Test captain Jasprit Bumrah "loves" red-ball cricket. "It's just the passion that Bumrah has...The more time we spent in the Mumbai camp, Bumrah just wanted to talk red-ball cricket," Jayawardena said. He added, "Bumrah doesn't want to miss a single Test...which is an asset for India...He prioritises his Test cricket."

190.title: 23-year-old YouTuber Technoblade passes away due to stage 4 cancer
190.article_body: YouTuber Technoblade has passed away at the age of 23 after battling stage four cancer over the past year. The American internet personality had nearly 11 million subscribers on YouTube, where he posted clips of himself playing Minecraft. "If I had another hundred lives...I would choose to be Technoblade again every single time," the YouTuber said in his last message.

191.title: Tamil, Telugu industries pushing boundaries through films: Huma Qureshi
191.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, while talking about her experience of working in South Indian film industries, said industries like Tamil and Telugu "are not talking down to their audience". "They are pushing their boundaries," she added. The actress said that these industries take pride in the cultural references. "The stories are contextual...they are personalised, nuanced," Huma added.

192.title: 32 IPS officers including Udaipur IG, SP transferred after tailor's murder
192.article_body: Following the beheading of tailor Kanhaiya Lal in Rajasthan, 32 IPS officers, including Udaipur Inspector General (IG) and Superintendent of Police (SP), have been transferred. While IG Hinglaj Dan was posted as IG Civil Rights, SP Manoj Kumar was transferred to the second battalion of Rajasthan Armed Constabulary (RAC) in Kota. Praful Kumar has been made the new Udaipur IG.

193.title: Happy with my performance: Neeraj on silver-win at Stockholm Diamond League
193.article_body: After Neeraj Chopra won a silver medal at Stockholm Diamond League, the Tokyo Olympics gold medallist said he's happy with his performance. "It was quite close to 90 metres, I had a feeling that it would go beyond it but that didn't happen," he added. Neeraj threw 89.94 metres and broke his national record. Notably, it was his personal best.

194.title: A couple of weeks ago, I was close to retirement: Rafael Nadal
194.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he was close to retirement a "couple of weeks" back, adding he has never been afraid of retirement from tennis. "It's clear that when that day comes, I will [have to] change," stated Nadal. Nadal, who is currently playing Wimbledon for the first time since the 2019 edition, admitted that "every day" is a challenge.

195.title: 2 Tanzanian nationals held with cocaine worth over ₹4 lakh in Pune
195.article_body: Pune City Police have arrested two Tanzanian nationals and recovered around 29 milligrams of cocaine, worth over ₹4 lakh, from their possession. Police had received a tip-off, following which they laid a trap and arrested the suspects. According to police, one of the suspects had come to India about two years ago and was earlier arrested in a narcotics case.

196.title: Actress Shivani Rajashekar opts out of Miss India 2022 due to college exams
196.article_body: Actress Shivani Rajashekar, daughter of veteran actors Rajasekhar and Jeevitha, recently took part in Miss India 2022 pageant and represented Tamil Nadu. However, due to college exams, she had to opt out. "Regarding my health, I'm doing much better, and in Guntur right now for my exams," she added. There won't be any representation from Tamil Nadu this year.

197.title: Indian-origin tech businessman arrested for ₹355 crore investment fraud in US
197.article_body: A 50-year-old Indian-origin tech entrepreneur has been arrested in US for a $45 million (over ₹355 crore) investment fraud in which he allegedly cheated more than 10,000 people. Neil Chandran used a group of technology firms that he owned in a scheme to defraud investors. He promised extremely high returns by claiming his companies will be acquired by wealthy buyers.

198.title: First time I saw disco was with SRK, remember looking for shoes: Manoj
198.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee recalled in an interview that the first time he ever saw a discotheque was with Shah Rukh Khan. He added that it was in Delhi in Maurya. "I still remember looking for shoes to get into the discotheque because I was in chappals," Manoj said. The two had studied acting together at Barry John Acting Studio.

199.title: 'Taarak Mehta...' team announces new Nattu Kaka, to be played by Kiran Bhatt
199.article_body: The makers of television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' have announced that theatre artist Kiran Bhatt will be portraying the character of Nattu Kaka. The character was originally portrayed by late actor Ghanshyam Nayak who passed away in October 2021 after a long battle with cancer. Kiran and Ghanshyam were friends and the former called it an emotional role.

200.title: Ukraine begins electricity exports to EU: President Zelenskyy
200.article_body: Ukraine has started exporting electricity to the European Union via Romania, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. "Thanks to Ukrainian electricity, a significant part of the Russian gas used by European consumers can be replaced...[This is therefore] not just a question of export revenue for us, it is a question of security for the whole of Europe," he added.

201.title: MS Dhoni gets knee treatment from vaidya who sits under a tree near Ranchi
201.article_body: Ex-India captain MS Dhoni is getting knee treatment from a vaidya who sits under a tree near Ranchi in Jharkhand. Dhoni has been visiting the vaidya for last one month at an interval of four days to get the treatment. "Dhoni comes like a normal patient without any pomp. He has no pride in being a celebrity," the vaidya said.

202.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states; IMD releases list
202.article_body: IMD has predicted heavy to very heavy rainfall over Rajasthan, Uttarakhand, Madhya Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim, Odisha, Gujarat, Karnataka and Kerala over the next few days. Heavy to very heavy rainfall is also likely over Goa during the next four days. Isolated heavy rainfall is predicted in Jharkhand on  1st, 2nd, 3rd and 5th July.

203.title: 4 Amarnath Yatra pilgrims hurt as vehicle slips off road, overturns
203.article_body: Four pilgrims undertaking the Amarnath Yatra were injured on Friday when their vehicle slipped off a road and overturned on the national highway in the Sher Bibi area of Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban, police said. The victims, who hail from Chhattisgarh and Uttar Pradesh, were rushed to a nearby hospital for treatment.

204.title: Rajkummar on & off camera are 2 different personalities: Sanya Malhotra
204.article_body: Sanya Malhotra, while speaking about working with Rajkummar Rao in 'HIT - The First Case' said, "Raj on set and...in front of the camera are two different personalities." "He's very passionate and...professional. Our energies matched on...set from day one," the actress added. 'HIT - The First Case' is the Hindi remake of the Telugu mystery action thriller of same name.

205.title: I'm genetically 'filmy', doctor announced my blood group as U/A: Ranbir
205.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said, "I've a bug in me...The bug of Hindi cinema." "It was obvious as my parents, grandparents and great grandparents, uncles and aunts...even my cousins are actors," he said, adding, "So I'm 'filmy' genetically...Doctor announced my blood group as U/A." U/A certificate is a censor rating given by the Central Board of Film Certification of India.

206.title: 15,000 pourakarmikas begin strike seeking permanent jobs in B'luru
206.article_body: Over 15,000 pourakarmikas (civic workers) began an indefinite strike in Bengaluru seeking permanent jobs and better pay on Friday. The pourakarmikas, waste collectors and manual labour, who keep the city clean, have also demanded dignified working conditions, safety equipment, etc. "We've been doing this work for the past 20 years but are yet to be made permanent," a pourakarmika said.

207.title: Gunmen attack Nigerian mine, kidnaps 4 Chinese nationals
207.article_body: Gunmen attacked a local mining site in northcentral Nigeria and abducted some workers, including four Chinese nationals, authorities said on Thursday. "Many security personnel" were killed in the attack, the Niger governor's office said. China in November had issued a travel advisory warning to its citizens and companies against travelling to "high-risk" areas in Nigeria and other parts of Africa.

208.title: India's playing XI for rescheduled 5th Test against England announced
208.article_body: England captain Ben Stokes won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the rescheduled fifth Test at Edgbaston. Team India captain Jasprit Bumrah announced that Cheteshwar Pujara will open the innings for India along with Shubman Gill. Meanwhile, Ravichandran Ashwin has not been included in the playing XI. Shardul Thakur and Ravindra Jadeja feature in the XI.

209.title: 50-year-old man jumps in front of Delhi Metro train, hospitalised
209.article_body: A 50-year-old man allegedly jumped in front of a train at Delhi's Moolchand metro station on Thursday, police said. The man, identified as Mahendar, suffered injuries in the incident and was later taken to AIIMS Trauma Centre, where he's recuperating. Meanwhile, DMRC alerted commuters about the delay in metro services from Kashmere Gate to Badarpur Border due to the incident.

210.title: Bill Gates shares his 48-year-old résumé, says 'I'm sure yours looks a lot better'
210.article_body: World's fourth-richest person Bill Gates shared his résumé from 1974 on LinkedIn and wrote, "Whether you're a recent grad or a college dropout, I'm sure your résumé looks a lot better than mine did 48 years ago." The résumé, which the Microsoft Co-founder wrote during his first year at Harvard, lists his objective as a "systems analyst or systems programmer".

211.title: Grass has right to grow & donkey has right to eat in a democracy: SC on Nupur's plea
211.article_body: Supreme Court Justice Surya Kant, while criticising Nupur Sharma for her comments on the Prophet, remarked, "In a democracy, everyone has the right to speak." He added, "In a democracy, grass has the right to grow and a donkey has the right to eat." Suspended BJP leader Nupur had sought to transfer FIRs filed against her to Delhi.

212.title: 54 kg high-grade ganja seized on Solapur-Pune highway; 2 arrested
212.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has seized 54 kilograms of high-grade ganja worth approximately ₹85 lakh on the Solapur-Pune highway, officials said. At least two persons have been arrested for peddling the contraband, that was sourced from Odisha's Ganjam. The drugs were destined for further distribution to peddlers in Mumbai, Gujarat's Surat and other adjoining areas.

213.title: Factually untrue: Edelweiss on report of firm putting its Mutual Fund business for sale
213.article_body: Edelweiss has issued a clarification after a report claimed that the company has put its Mutual Fund business for sale. In a statement, Edelweiss said, "We strongly...deny the report...the news is factually untrue and purely speculative and motivated by vested interests." It further called its MF business a "strong franchisee" and shared its growth numbers.

214.title: Woman dies by suicide a month after husband's death in Gurugram; leaves note
214.article_body: A woman allegedly died by suicide a month after her husband was killed in a road accident in Gurugram. The 32-year-old woman was found hanging at her rented accommodation in Gurugram and was undergoing a financial crisis, police said. Notably, the deceased left a five-page suicide note in which she urged her mother to take care of her 10-year-old daughter.

215.title: PMC to declare alternate day water supply due to deficit rainfall
215.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will declare a timetable for an alternate day water supply in the city from next week, Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. He added that this is due to a deficit in rainfall, which has caused less availability of water in dams. "There's hardly 2.5 TMC water in...dams supplying water to the city," a civic officer said.

216.title: UP CM Adityanath launches Amazon's first Digital Kendra in UP
216.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has launched Amazon's first Digital Kendra in the state at an event in Lucknow. Amazon also signed two MoUs with MSMEs and the export promotion department of Uttar Pradesh. As part of the MoUs, Amazon will train and onboard MSMEs from the state on its Global Selling programme and export their products globally.

217.title: Ronaldo's lawyers seek $626,000 from rape accuser's lawyer in Las Vegas case
217.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo's lawyers have asked a US judge to order the rape accuser's lawyer to pay the footballer $626,000 for claiming in a failed lawsuit that Ronaldo raped the woman in Las Vegas in 2009. This comes after a US judge dismissed the 2018 Nevada lawsuit, saying the alleged victim's lawyer harmed Ronaldo by conducting himself in "bad faith".

218.title: Nupur should have filed an FIR against the anchor if there was misuse of debate: SC
218.article_body: On being told by Nupur Sharma's counsel that her comments on Prophet were only in response to a fellow panellist and anchor Navika Kumar, the Supreme Court said there should've been a case against the host as well. "If there was misuse of...debate...the first thing [Nupur] should've done was to file an FIR against the anchor," the apex court said.

219.title: Some people love to take me down but they won't get me: Nick Kyrgios
219.article_body: Following a recent video where he was seen spitting in the direction of an abusive spectator during a Wimbledon 2022 match, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios said, "Some people love to take me down. They won't get me." "I don't really care if there's an investigation...for what happened the other day...People do not respect me on certain occasions," added Kyrgios.

220.title: India announce 22-member squad for World Athletics Championships
220.article_body: The Athletics Federation of India (AFI) has announced a 22-member squad for the upcoming World Athletics Championships. Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra has been included in the squad. The 22-member squad includes 17 male athletes and five female athletes. Seven of the 16 athletes, who will compete in individual events, are National Record holders, the AFI stated.

221.title: ₹1.5 lakh cr wiped off Reliance's market value as govt raises export duty on fuel
221.article_body: Nearly ₹1.5 lakh crore has been wiped out from the market capitalisation of Reliance Industries after its stock declined as much as 8.7% on Friday, marking its biggest intraday drop since November 2, 2020. The shares fell after the Centre raised export duty on fuel. ONGC shares also plunged by 12.3% on Friday, its biggest slide since March 23, 2020.

222.title: 70-year-old man killed while he was asleep in Raj; at least 10 booked
222.article_body: A 70-year-old man was allegedly killed while he was asleep in his field in Rajasthan's Baran, police said. Around 10-12 locals have been booked for the alleged murder, police added. A suspect claimed the man recently electrocuted and killed one of their relatives. The victim had a fatal head injury, suggesting he was murdered with some heavy stone, police stated.

223.title: Missing 'Crypto Queen' Ruja Ignatova added to FBI's most wanted list for $4 bn fraud
223.article_body: Ruja Ignatova, also known as "Crypto Queen", has been placed on the FBI's top 10 most wanted list. Ignatova, who has been missing since 2017, is wanted for her alleged role in running a cryptocurrency scam known as OneCoin. Federal investigators accuse her of using the scheme to defraud victims out of more than $4 billion.

224.title: We are as good as married: Pavitra on relationship with Eijaz Khan
224.article_body: Actress Pavitra Punia, while speaking about her relationship with Eijaz Khan, said, "Everyone is always asking us about our marriage but honestly, we're as good as married." "When you've lived with someone for long, you stop looking at each other as boyfriend, girlfriend," she added. Pavitra further said they have been planning to marry since last year.

225.title: Russia using less precise Soviet-era missiles in Ukraine: General
225.article_body: Russia is using old Soviet-era missiles that are less accurate for more than 50% of its strikes in Ukraine, a brigadier general in Ukraine's armed forces said. Brigadier General Oleksii Hromov added that around 202 missiles had been fired on Ukraine in the second half of June, an increase of 120 from the first half of the month.

226.title: Will ensure error-free caste census in Bihar: Ex-JD(U) MP Anwar
226.article_body: Former JD(U) Rajya Sabha MP Ali Anwar has said that social organisations will ensure an error-free caste census takes place in Bihar. "Now that the caste survey is taking place, the ruling dispensation would get to know the bitter truth at home about the poor economic and educational status of a large section of the society," Anwar said.

227.title: We won't disturb new Maha govt, they must work for public: Raut
227.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has claimed that the BJP said from the first day that they'll "disturb" Uddhav Thackeray's government, however, his party "won't disturb" the new Maharashtra government. This comes after rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis were sworn in as state CM and Deputy CM respectively. "They must work for...public," Raut said.

228.title: McCullum has a gift of getting into people's heads: Ex-Eng captain Gower
228.article_body: Ex-England captain David Gower said England Test head coach Brendon McCullum has a "gift" of getting into people's heads and making them feel better. "When McCullum's appointment was announced, people were wondering what his qualifications were. They are now apparent," added Gower. Talking about England Test captain Ben Stokes, Gower stated that Stokes has a "bulletproof" approach to cricket.

229.title: 19-yr-old runs over policeman to escape checkpoint in Mumbai; arrested
229.article_body: A 19-year-old youth was arrested for allegedly ramming his two-wheeler into a 56-year-old policeman at a checkpoint in Mumbai's Wadala area on Wednesday. The youth, who was stopped for driving without helmet, ran over the policeman in an attempt to escape but was nabbed by other officials. The policeman sustained three fractures in his right shoulder and other minor injuries.

230.title: 'You Hold The Cards': Shahid Kapoor in PokerBaazi's brand film
230.article_body: PokerBaazi.com has launched a campaign 'You Hold The Cards' featuring Shahid Kapoor. The campaign aims to highlight how luck controls outcomes in life while in poker, players' skills can triumph over luck. Kapoor said, "I look forward to helping PokerBaazi reach wider audiences & create advocates for the sport,” resonating with the brand's mission of making poker a household game.

231.title: Lost out on Slumdog Millionaire as I was too good-looking for it: Gauahar
231.article_body: Actress Gauahar Khan has revealed that she lost out on the Academy Award-winning movie 'Slumdog Millionaire' because she was "too good-looking for it". "He (Danny Boyle, director) said 'You're...a fab actor but somehow I won't be able to cast you...because I've to match three age groups...and I can't place you in a Slumdog Millionaire with your face'," Gauahar added.

232.title: Good to see Pujara decided to play in county cricket: Harbhajan
232.article_body: Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh has said that it's "good to see" that batter Cheteshwar Pujara picked the option of playing in England's county cricket. "He has been playing continuously in English conditions. Though you might say that in county cricket, the quality of bowlers is not like in international cricket...[But over there] you encounter one-two (international) bowlers," Singh said.

233.title: South African man charged with record $1.7 bn Bitcoin fraud in US
233.article_body: The US commodities regulator CFTC has charged a South African man and his company for operating a fraudulent commodity pool worth over $1.7 billion in Bitcoin. It is the largest fraud scheme the CFTC has ever pursued involving Bitcoin. The firm claimed to have proprietary software that would realise significant trading gains for investors who pooled their Bitcoin with it.

234.title: He raised standards of parliamentary debates: PM on VP Naidu's b'day
234.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday wished Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on his birthday and called him an "inspiration for the citizens". "As our VP, he has played a key role in raising the standards of parliamentary proceedings and debates. Praying for his long life," PM Modi tweeted. Notably, Vice President Venkaiah Naidu's term will end on August 10.

235.title: WhatsApp may get animated avatars for video calls, stickers: Report
235.article_body: WhatsApp is reportedly working on emoji-inspired avatars as its latest feature. As per a report, users can use these avatars as their profile pictures and during video calls when the camera is switched off. While the feature is still not in its final form, the avatars may also be available as stickers that can be shared within chats.

236.title: I came close to getting married thrice, all three times god saved me: Sushmita Sen
236.article_body: Opening up about marriage, actress Sushmita Sen said, "Luckily I met some very interesting men in my life, the only reason I never got married is [that] they were a let down." She added, "I came close to getting married thrice, all three times god saved me. I can't tell you what disasters followed with their respective lives."

237.title: Sushmita's brother, wife Charu to separate; he says 'Didn't know about her 1st marriage'
237.article_body: Sushmita Sen's brother Rajeev and his wife Charu Asopa are heading towards a divorce. Rajeev said he was not aware of Charu's first marriage, adding, "It was...kept hidden from us." Meanwhile, Charu said, "Not only did he know about it, but also appreciated me for moving on from my past." Rajeev and Charu tied the knot in 2019.

238.title: What has Delhi Police done? There must be red carpet for you: SC to Nupur's lawyer
238.article_body: While refusing to allow suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's plea for transferring FIRs registered against her over remarks on Prophet Muhammad to Delhi, the Supreme Court said, "What has Delhi police done...Don't make us open our mouth." After being told by her lawyer that she has joined probe, the court remarked, "Then what happened...There must have been...red carpet for you."

239.title: Afghan Sikhs arrive in Delhi, bring ashes of man killed in gurdwara attack
239.article_body: Eleven Afghan Sikhs arrived in New Delhi on Thursday less than two weeks after two people were killed in a terrorist attack on a gurdwara in Kabul. They also brought the ashes of Sawinder Singh, who was killed in the June 18 attack. The Indian government had on June 19 granted emergency e-visas to 111 Afghan Hindus and Sikhs.

240.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 2 inter-state drug peddlers, seize 25 kg ganja
240.article_body: The Hyderabad Police said that they have arrested two inter-state drug peddlers and recovered 25 kg of ganja from them. According to police, the accused have been smuggling drugs since 2020 and have ties with drug dealers in Andhra Pradesh. Based on a tip-off, the police arrested the accused on Tuesday while they were proceeding towards Borabanda from Nacharam.

241.title: Maha Guv asks CM Eknath Shinde to prove majority in Assembly on July 4
241.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari has asked CM Eknath Shinde to prove a majority in Assembly on July 4 (Monday). A special session of the Maharashtra Assembly is scheduled to be held on July 3 and 4. The nomination for Speaker's elections will be filed on July 2 and the Speaker's elections will be held on July 3.

242.title: Instagram tests turning video posts into Reels
242.article_body: Instagram has said that it is testing a change that turns video posts into Reels. "We're testing this feature as part of our efforts to simplify and improve the video experience on Instagram," a spokesperson from Meta said. People who are part of the test will reportedly see an in-app message that says "video posts are now shared as Reels".

243.title: 30 riders booked in last 2 days for excessive bike noise in Pune
243.article_body: In a drive conducted by the Pimpri-Chinchwad Police, around 30 riders have been booked in the past two days for tinkering with their bike silencers and causing noise pollution in Pune. The riders have been booked under the Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Rules, 2000, police said. Notably, several residents have complained of excessive bike noise, police added.

244.title: 8-yr-old girl dies after scorpion stings her at C'garh govt school
244.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died after a scorpion stung her while she was playing at a government school in Chhattisgarh's Bemetara, officials said on Thursday. The girl was being shifted to Raipur due to her critical condition but she died on the way, officials added. On state CM's order, District Education Officer provided ₹1 lakh financial assistance to the girl's father.

245.title: Ecuador govt, indigenous groups sign deal to end 18 days of protests
245.article_body: The Ecuadorian government and indigenous groups’ leaders on Thursday signed an agreement to end 18 days of protests against soaring fuel and food prices. As part of the deal, Ecuador’s government has agreed to lower the fuel costs by 15 cents per gallon. The deal also sets limits on the expansion of oil exploration areas and restricts certain mining activities.

246.title: Mom was very happy with me playing a sardar in 'Rocket Singh': Ranbir
246.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, while speaking about his 2009 film 'Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year', said, "This film broke my heart when it didn't do well." "My mother was very happy with me playing a sardar because she's a sardarni," he added. Ranbir further said he meets a lot of people who appreciate the film and his character in the film.

247.title: 4 carry weapons in bid to rob people near Pune rly station, held
247.article_body: Pune police arrested four persons, aged between 19 and 29, who were planning to rob people near the city's railway station. The incident occurred on Wednesday and the accused were carrying weapons and chilli powder, officials said. "Our team laid a trap near station where we nabbed them, but one of the gang members fled the spot," an official said.

248.title: Eng will win 5th Test, India would've won the series last year: Moeen
248.article_body: England all-rounder Moeen Ali said they "will win" the rescheduled fifth Test of the series against India which they trail 1-2 as India are "undercooked". "If this series had finished off last year, India would have won it," added Moeen. The Test series initially started in 2021 with the fifth Test cancelled due to COVID-19 fears and eventually rescheduled.

249.title: Received a love letter: Pawar on IT notices regarding election affidavits
249.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday tweeted that he has received notices from Income Tax (IT) department over his election affidavits in 2004, 2009, 2014 and 2020. "This device is utilised against those who hold views different than those of the Centre. I have received such a love letter," Pawar wrote. Notably, Eknath Shinde became Maharashtra's new CM on Thursday.

250.title: RIL shares fall by 5%, its biggest decline in 18 months after govt raises fuel excise duty
250.article_body: After the Centre announced an increase in taxes on the export of petrol, diesel, and aviation turbine fuel (ATF), shares of Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL), ONGC and Oil India witnessed a decline. While RIL shares plunged over 5% in its biggest decline in about 18 months, shares of ONGC dropped by 10% during intraday trade on Friday.

251.title: FBI adds 'Cryptoqueen' to 10 Most Wanted Fugitive list, offers reward
251.article_body: The FBI has added OneCoin cryptocurrency Founder Ruja Ignatova, also known as "Cryptoqueen", to its Ten Most Wanted Fugitive list for allegedly defrauding investors of over $4 billion over three years. A reward of up to $100,000 has been offered for her arrest. Ignatova allegedly made false statements and representations to individuals in order to solicit investments in OneCoin.

252.title: This lady is single-handedly responsible for what's happening in India: SC on Nupur
252.article_body: While hearing suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's plea to transfer FIRs over remarks on Prophet Muhammad, the Supreme Court said she should apologise to entire nation on TV. "The way she...ignited emotions across the country...this lady is single-handedly responsible for what's happening in the country...She and her loose tongue has set the entire country on fire," the Supreme Court said.

253.title: B'luru police raid gambling den, seize ₹1 lakh cash; 22 arrested
253.article_body: The Bengaluru police's Crime Branch conducted a raid at a gambling den and arrested 22 persons, Joint CP (Crime) Raman Gupta tweeted on Thursday. He said that the accused had been engaged in Andar Bahar game and cash worth a total of over ₹1 lakh was also seized from them. He added that of the total accused, 18 are customers.

254.title: Would've made more sense to pick Pujara as captain: Jaffer on 5th Test
254.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said it would have made "more sense" to pick Cheteshwar Pujara as the captain for the fifth rescheduled Test against England rather than Jasprit Bumrah. "I've seen Pujara lead in first-class cricket. He's a decent enough leader...Bumrah hasn't [been a] captain at all...[However] Bumrah might surprise us as Hardik Pandya did [as a captain]," added Jaffer.

255.title: Uddhav has lost the spirit to fight: Former Maharashtra CM Chavan
255.article_body: Congress leader and former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan said Uddhav Thackeray has lost his fighting spirit. "Uddhav Thackeray should have put forth his view within the state assembly. Thereafter, he could have resigned. People should have known his views," Chavan stated. He further claimed that Eknath Shinde had wished to become Chief Minister the way Manohar Joshi became in 1995.

256.title: China's Xi swears in new Hong Kong leader as city marks 25 yrs of handover
256.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday officiated the swearing-in ceremony of Hong Kong's new leader John Lee as the city marked 25 years since its handover from British to Chinese rule. Following the swearing-in, the Chinese President said there was no reason to change Hong Kong's "one country, two systems" formula of governance as it has proven to be successful.

257.title: Shiv Sena moves SC seeking suspension of Maharashtra CM, 15 rebel MLAs
257.article_body: Shiv Sena chief whip Sunil Prabhu has moved the Supreme Court seeking suspension of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and 15 rebel MLAs till the decision on their disqualification is taken. The plea seeks an order restraining them from entering the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly. The disqualification notices were earlier issued to 16 rebel MLAs by state Assembly's Deputy Speaker Narhari Zirwal.

258.title: Govt increases export duty on petrol by ₹5 per litre, diesel by ₹12 per litre
258.article_body: The government on Friday increased the export duty on petrol, diesel, and aviation turbine fuel (ATF). Export duty on petrol has been raised by ₹5 per litre and ₹12 per litre on diesel. Export duty on ATF has been upped by ₹6 per litre. Increase in export duty on the various fuels will not increase domestic fuel prices.

259.title: Plum announces its Birthday Bash sale with discounts of up to 50%
259.article_body: 100% vegan beauty and personal care brand Plum has announced its biggest sale of the season, 'The Plum Birthday Bash', from July 1 to 4. The brand is offering discounts of up to 50% along with exciting freebies worth ₹1,500, Plum stated, adding that one lucky winner stands a chance to win an iPhone 13 every day.

260.title: Mumbai sees waterlogging, traffic jams amid rains; orange alert issued
260.article_body: Amid heavy rains on Thursday, several parts of Mumbai witnessed waterlogging and traffic jams. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an 'orange' alert for Mumbai predicting heavy to very heavy showers over the next two days. Mumbai received 119.09 mm of rain from 8 am to 8 pm on Thursday, as per the city's civic body.

261.title: Ashwin has had Stokes' measure a lot over his career: Watson on 5th Test
261.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said he is "really looking forward" to the battle between Ravichandran Ashwin and England Test captain Ben Stokes in the rescheduled fifth Test. "Ashwin has had his measure a lot over his career," added Watson. "Ashwin is going to be the main man to try and make the most of that battle," he stated.

262.title: You never know who you’ll run into in New York: Bill Gates on meeting Mahesh, Namrata
262.article_body: After actor Mahesh Babu shared a picture of himself and his wife Namrata Shirodkar meeting Bill Gates, the Microsoft Co-founder said, "Being in New York is always fun." He added, "You never know who you’ll run into. It was great meeting you and Namrata!" Mahesh responded, "Honour is all ours, Mr Gates! One of our favourite moments ever."

263.title: Govt hikes import tax on gold from 7.5% to 12.5% amid declining rupee
263.article_body: The central government has raised the basic import tax on gold to 12.5% from 7.5% as the Indian rupee declined to a record low. India, the world's second-biggest consumer of gold, imported gold worth $6.03 billion in May, a nine-fold rise from a year earlier. Notably, last year the Centre had cut the tax to 7.5% in the Budget.

264.title: 'Strange' cloud hangs over Ukraine's Kyiv, video of dry thunderstorm goes viral
264.article_body: A video of a dry thunderstorm in Ukraine's capital Kyiv has gone viral on social media. Olexander Scherba, a former Ukrainian diplomat, tweeted, "The whole Kyiv saw and heard the strange cloud hanging over the city. Thunder and lightning without storm." Reacting to the video, a user tweeted, "Guardians of the Galaxy!"

265.title: I'm done with 'Tanu Weds...', don't want to go back to being Manu: Madhavan
265.article_body: R Madhavan, on being asked if he'd be returning as Manu in another 'Tanu Weds Manu' movie, said he's done with the franchise and doesn't want to go back to being Manu now. "There's no point in beating a dead horse," he added. "If it's...sequel to Avengers...it's easier because you've a template...But with Tanu Weds Manu, it's impossible," said Madhavan.

266.title: Always playing a hero is boring: John on playing villain in Ek Villain Returns
266.article_body: John Abraham, speaking about doing a negative role in 'Ek Villain Returns', said, "Always playing a hero is boring...It's good to play...villain." He added it's kind of a homecoming for him as he played a character with a negative shade in his 2003 film 'Jism'. John further said he loved the script when he heard it for the first time.

267.title: Drugs worth ₹58.84 cr seized in Mumbai so far this year: Police
267.article_body: The Mumbai Police has seized over 1,000 kg of drugs worth ₹58.84 crore in the city from January till May this year. Police also arrested 4,968 people for their alleged involvement in drug-related offences during the period. According to data provided by the police, the most valued seized drugs include mephedrone (MD) worth ₹18 crore and heroin worth ₹11.94 crore.

268.title: Hyd startup successfully tests satellite deployer on ISRO's PSLV C53
268.article_body: Hyderabad-based space tech startup Dhruva Space has successfully tested and space-qualified its satellite orbital deployer (DSOD 1U) which was aboard ISRO's PSLV C53 on June 30. Dhruva Space utilised the PSLV Orbital Experimental Module (POEM) for the test. The successful test has laid the path for the startup's satellite missions, Thybolt-1 and Thybolt-2, which would be onboard PSLV C54 mission.

269.title: We beat NZ who're the world's best team but India are different: Stokes
269.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes said he considers New Zealand whom his team defeated 3-0 in the recently concluded Test series as the "best team in the world". "India are obviously a completely different opposition [and] a different dynamic of a team," stated Stokes. England will take on India in the fifth rescheduled Test which starts today.

270.title: Root can surpass Tendulkar's record of most Test runs: Compton
270.article_body: Former English cricketer Nick Compton has said that batter Joe Root can surpass former India batter Sachin Tendulkar's record of most runs in Test cricket. "I think he can. He's (Root) young and is right up there with Tendulkar in terms of runs scored at 31 [years of age]...If he can keep going like this, he'll get there," Compton said.

271.title: I think Fadnavis didn't accept Maha Deputy CM post happily: Pawar
271.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar claimed on Thursday that he doesn't think that former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis accepted the Deputy CM post "happily", adding, "His facial expression said it all." "[Fadnavis] must have followed...orders from the top," he also claimed. Furthermore, he alleged that rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde "himself had no idea" that he'd get the CM post.

272.title: Ketanji Jackson sworn in, becomes 1st Black woman on US Supreme Court
272.article_body: Ketanji Brown Jackson has been sworn in as a US Supreme Court justice, becoming the first black woman to serve on the nation's highest court. "Her historic swearing-in...represents a profound step forward for our nation, for all...young, Black girls who now see themselves reflected on our highest court, and for all of us as Americans," US President Joe Biden said.

273.title: Kohli will get the ton he's 'desperate' for if he scores 30: Vaughan
273.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said Virat Kohli will score the century he has been "desperately" seeking for a "long period of time", if he scores 30 runs in the upcoming fifth rescheduled Test against England. "Just go back a few years when he produced one of the greatest Test match centuries [at Edgbaston]. I think he's due," added Vaughan.

274.title: Rupee hits fresh record low of 79.12 against US dollar
274.article_body: Amid a strengthening dollar and rising global crude oil prices, the Indian rupee hit a fresh record low of 79.12 against the US dollar after the currency opened at 78.98 in Friday's session. The rupee had touched the 79-mark for the first time ever after it closed at a record low of 79.03 against the US dollar on Wednesday.

275.title: Ex-Apple exec's firm files for bankruptcy months after going public
275.article_body: Former Apple and JC Penney executive Ron Johnson-led retail startup Enjoy Technology has filed for bankruptcy, months after going public through a special-purpose acquisition company (SPAC). The startup plans to sell its US assets to technology repair company Asurion. A court filing has said that Enjoy has struggled with declining liquidity and an inability to retain staff.

276.title: SpaceX gets nod to use its Starlink internet on boats, planes in US
276.article_body: The US FCC has authorised Elon Musk-owned SpaceX to use its Starlink satellite internet system on moving vehicles, like trucks, boats and aircraft. "Authorising a new class of terminals for SpaceX's satellite system will expand the range of broadband capabilities to meet the growing user demands," the FCC said. SpaceX has launched over 2,500 Starlink satellites to low-Earth orbit.

277.title: Woman, lover arrested for killing aunt, her son over ₹4 lakh loan in UP
277.article_body: A woman and her lover were arrested for allegedly killing her 40-year-old aunt and the latter's 18-year-old son in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, police said. The accused were unable to repay a loan of ₹4 lakh taken from victims almost a year ago, police added. This comes three months after the bodies of the victims were found floating in a canal.

278.title: Daily wager electrocuted to death while disconnecting 11kV wire in Gurugram
278.article_body: A daily wager died of electrocution while trying to disconnect a 11kV wire from an electric pole in Gurugram. The deceased, Sheikh Chotu (27), was asked by a private firm's officials to disconnect high-tension wires, police said. Meanwhile, the two employees of the firm have been booked. Notably, this is the second such death within a fortnight in the city.

279.title: Don't gather at ED office: Raut to Sena workers ahead of questioning
279.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has tweeted that he'll appear before Enforcement Directorate (ED) today at 12 noon and appealed to his party workers to "not gather" at the agency's office. Raut is being questioned by ED in a money laundering case linked to Patra Chawl redevelopment scam. "I respect [ED's summons]...it's my duty to co-operate with...investigation agencies," he said.

280.title: Ban on single-use plastic items in India comes into effect from today
280.article_body: The ban on single-use plastic items in India has come into effect from today. The ban prohibits manufacture, import, stocking, distribution, sale and use of the following identified single-use plastic items, which have low utility and high littering potential. The single-use plastic items prohibited include earbuds, straws, plates, cups, forks, spoons and knives, among other items.

281.title: Actor Kamal Haasan receives UAE's Golden Visa
281.article_body: The United Arab Emirates has given Golden Visa to actor Kamal Haasan. Vijay Sethupathi, Trisha, Mohanlal, Mammootty, Tovino Thomas, Dulquer Salmaan and Jayasurya are among other members of the South Indian film fraternity who have received the visa. The Golden Visa permits long-term (5 and 10 years) residency for foreigners.

282.title: Steak, sausage can't be used to describe vegetarian food: France
282.article_body: France will become the first European Union country to ban the use of meat names like "steak" and "sausage" to describe plant-based food, according to an official decree. "It'll not be possible to use sector-specific terminology traditionally associated with meat and fish to designate products that don't belong to the animal world and which, in essence, aren't comparable," decree read.

283.title: Man on scooter throws bomb at CPI(M) headquarters in Kerala; video surfaces
283.article_body: A man on a scooter threw a crude bomb at the Kerala headquarters of the ruling CPI(M) on Thursday night in Thiruvananthapuram. The video of the incident shows that the bomb exploded in front of the main gate of the party office. Reportedly, several CPI(M) leaders were at an apartment near the office at the time of the attack.

284.title: India sees 17,070 new COVID-19 cases, 1,749 less than yesterday
284.article_body: India recorded 17,070 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to latest data by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 18,819 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,07,189, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,139, according to the latest data.

285.title: Reliance to launch British sandwich & coffee chain Pret A Manger in India
285.article_body: Reliance Industries on Thursday said it will be opening outlets of British sandwich and coffee chain Pret A Manger in India, marking its first foray into the food and beverage retail business. The first outlet would reportedly open in Mumbai before March 2023. Pret A Manger, whose name means "ready to eat" in French, first opened in London in 1986.

286.title: Nadal enters 3rd round of Wimbledon after beating Ricardas Berankis
286.article_body: Rafael Nadal entered Wimbledon's third round after beating world number 106 Ricardas Berankis, which marked his 307th win in a Grand Slam match. Nadal made 39 unforced errors and recorded 35 winners in the match whose scoreline read 6-4, 6-4, 4-6, 6-3. Nadal lost the third set having won the opening two sets marking the second instance in two matches.

287.title: Eknath Shinde changes Twitter profile pic to one with Bal Thackeray after becoming CM
287.article_body: After taking oath as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, Eknath Shinde changed the profile picture of his Twitter handle to one with Bal Thackeray. Shinde had earlier said that Uddhav Thackeray had diluted the Hindutva ideology of Bal Thackeray by forming a coalition with Sharad Pawar's Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) and the Congress, which he called an "unnatural alliance".

288.title: Situation in India a cause for fear, there is a reason to be afraid now: Amartya Sen
288.article_body: Nobel laureate Amartya Sen has said, "I think if someone asks me if I'm scared of something, I would say 'yes'. There is a reason to be afraid now. The current situation in India has become a cause for fear." "India cannot be of Hindus only. Again, Muslims alone cannot make India. Everyone has to work together," he added.

289.title: There are people at Meta who shouldn't be here: Zuckerberg on hiring cuts
289.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg while informing his employees about the hiring cuts at the company this year, remarked, "There are probably a bunch of people at the company who shouldn't be here." Speaking about "turning up the heat" on performance, "I think some of you might decide that this place isn't for you, and that self-selection is okay with me."

290.title: Cryptocurrencies are a clear danger: RBI Governor
290.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das on Thursday described cryptocurrencies as a "clear danger", adding, "Anything that derives value based on make-believe, without any underlying, is just speculation under a sophisticated name." In the foreword to the 25th issue of the Financial Stability Report (FSR), Das also noted that as the financial system gets increasingly digitalised, cyber risks are growing.

291.title: Google to pay $90 mn to settle case with developers over app store
291.article_body: Google has agreed to pay $90 million to settle a case with app developers for allegedly violating antitrust laws and harming developers through app store policies. It allegedly used its deal with smartphone makers, technical barriers and revenue-sharing agreements to close the app ecosystem. Google has said it would put $90 million in a fund to support certain developers.

292.title: 2 B'luru policemen save boy attempting to die by suicide; rewarded
292.article_body: Two police officers in Bengaluru, ASI Ramesh and HC Chandrashekhar, were rewarded after they saved a boy who was attempting to die by suicide, DCP (South Division) P Krishnakant tweeted on Thursday. The DCP said that the police officers had rushed to the spot, rescued the "unconscious boy" and shifted him to a hospital. "A life was saved," he added.

293.title: Traffic diversions announced in Hyd for BJP's national executive meet
293.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police have released a traffic advisory in view of the national executive meet of BJP on July 2 and 3. While vehicles will be diverted at COD Junction, people have also been asked to avoid the Hitex and Cyber Towers Junctions. Offices located between Kavuri Hills and Kothaguda Junction have been advised to stagger work timings accordingly.

294.title: 2 buildings collapse in Mumbai's Kalbadevi, Sion; 3 such incidents in 4 days
294.article_body: A portion of a 100-year-old building in Mumbai's Kalbadevi collapsed on Thursday and no casualties were reported. Another such incident happened in Sion where a portion of ground-plus-five structures fell. The Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority was carrying out repair works at the Kalbadevi building. Notably, this takes the total number of such incidents to three in four days.

295.title: Europe to see high levels of COVID-19 this summer, warns WHO
295.article_body: The World Health Organization said it expects "high levels" of COVID-19 in Europe this summer. COVID-19 "won't go away just because countries stop looking for it. It's still spreading...changing and...taking lives", WHO Europe's Regional Director Hans Kluge said. The 53 countries in WHO's European region are now reporting nearly 5,00,000 cases daily, up from 1,50,000 at May-end, WHO data showed.

296.title: Pantaloons announces Grand Fashion Sale with upto 60% off
296.article_body: Pantaloons has announced its Grand Fashion Sale with up to 60% off on women's, men's, and kids' clothing. Customers can avail discounts by visiting the Pantaloons stores or shopping online via the Pantaloons website or app. "Don't pick just one or two styles when you can buy them all, grab the trendiest styles at your nearest store," said the brand.

297.title: Video shows Neeraj Chopra nearly breaching 90-metre mark to break his own national record
297.article_body: A video shows India's Olympic gold-medal winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra nearly breaching the 90-metre mark to break his own national record. The 24-year-old set the national record with a best throw of 89.94 metres at the Stockholm Diamond League. It was the second time in a month that Neeraj broke his own national record.

298.title: Wasim Jaffer names India playing XI for Test against England that begins today
298.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer has named his Team India playing XI for the rescheduled fifth Test against England that will begin at Edgbaston today. Jaffer named Shubman Gill and Cheteshwar Pujara as the openers. He also included both Ravindra Jadeja and Ravichandran Ashwin in the team. He named Hanuma Vihari as the number three batter.

299.title: Meta to reduce hiring, warns staff of 'serious times' in internal memo
299.article_body: CEO Mark Zuckerberg told Meta employees that it will reduce hiring engineers by at least 30% this year. He added, "This might be one of the worst downturns...we've seen in recent history". Meanwhile, Chief Product Officer Chris Cox in an internal memo to the staff also wrote, "I have to underscore that we're in serious times here and...headwinds are fierce."

300.title: 50-yr-old man smoking on 10th floor balcony slips in Gurugram, dies
300.article_body: A 50-year-old man, who was smoking on the balcony of the 10th floor of a building in Gurugram's Sector-83 on Thursday, allegedly accidentally slipped and fell to death, police said. The balcony fencing was short due to which he might have lost his balance, police added. The family members do not suspect any foul play, police further said.

301.title: Rottweiler attacks retired policeman, his dog in Pune; FIR filed
301.article_body: A case has been filed after Rottweiler attacked a retired Assistant Commissioner of Police (ACP) and his dog while they were out for a walk. The ACP had previously told the Rottweiler's owner that the dog breed wasn't allowed in residential areas due to their aggressive nature, according to the complaint. The Rottweiler had pounced on and bitten the ACP.

302.title: Lightning hits boat carrying 7 people in US; incident caught on camera
302.article_body: The US Coast Guard rescued seven people after the boat they were in was struck by lightning 100 miles off the coast of Florida. None of the passengers were injured in the incident, which was caught on camera. The occupants of the boat were brought back to an air station where they met their relatives, the US Coast Guard said.

303.title: 'Alien things' near border with S Korea responsible for COVID-19 outbreak: N Korea
303.article_body: North Korea on Friday claimed that the country's first COVID-19 outbreak began with people touching "alien things" near the border with South Korea. North Korea ordered people to "vigilantly deal with alien things coming by wind and other climate phenomena and balloons in the areas along the demarcation line and borders", according to state media.

304.title: Mumbai teen dies by suicide after sister throws phone in drain
304.article_body: A 17-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide after her elder sister threw her mobile phone into a drain in Mumbai's Malad on Thursday, police said. The deceased was involved with a boy and her family had found out about it, an official said. The girl's elder sister scolded her and threw her phone in a drain, the official added.

305.title: Team India squads for T20I and ODI series against England announced
305.article_body: Team India squads for T20I and ODI series against England have been announced. Captain Rohit Sharma, who will miss the Test, will return for both the ODI and T20I series. Virat Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah will join the white-ball squad from second T20I onwards. Shikhar Dhawan, Prasidh Krishna, Mohammad Shami and Mohammed Siraj have been selected just for ODI series.

306.title: Neeraj breaks his own national record again, finishes 2nd at Stockholm Diamond League
306.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra broke his own national record at the Stockholm Diamond League. The 24-year-old finished runner-up in the event with a best throw of 89.94 metres. He had set the previous national record with an 89.30-metre throw at the Paavo Nurmi Games earlier this month after breaking his own national record of 88.07-metre throw.

307.title: Uddhav congratulates CM Shinde, says 'I wish you do a good job in Maharashtra'
307.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday congratulated Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on being sworn in as new CM and Deputy CM respectively. "I wish you do a good job in Maharashtra!" Thackeray said on Twitter. Thackeray resigned as the CM on Wednesday after the Supreme Court rejected Shiv Sena's plea to stay floor test.

308.title: Mahhi accuses cook of threatening to kill her family, says 'Scared for daughter's life'
308.article_body: Actor-couple Mahhi Vij and Jay Bhanushali filed a police complaint on Thursday after their cook allegedly threatened to kill them. "He openly told me he will kill me with khanjar...Scared for my...daughter's life," she wrote in a series of now-deleted tweets. "When we went to the police station he kept calling me. I have all the recordings," Mahhi told ETimes.

309.title: Tom Hiddleston, fiancée Zawe Ashton expecting 1st child; pic shows actress' baby bump
309.article_body: Actor Tom Hiddleston and his fiancée, actress Zawe Ashton are expecting their first child together. Zawe, who attended the premiere of her new movie 'Mr Malcolm's List' in New York, was photographed with her baby bump for the first time. Hiddleston confirmed his engagement with the actress earlier in June.

310.title: Special Maha Assembly sessions on July 2, 3; Speaker election to be held
310.article_body: The Maharashtra Cabinet has decided to call special sessions of the Assembly on July 2 and 3. On the first day of the session, the election for Speaker will be completed as the post is vacant since Nana Patole's resignation. The decision comes after Eknath Shinde took oath as the new Chief Minister of Maharashtra.

311.title: 18-year-old girl dies of rabies a month after being bitten by dog in Kerala
311.article_body: An 18-year-old student, who was being treated for rabies, passed away on Thursday, a month after she was bitten by a dog in Kerala's Palakkad district, her relative said. The girl, who took anti-rabies injections, was reportedly taken to a private hospital after she started showing symptoms. The dog reportedly also bit its owner a day before biting her.

312.title: Punjab passes resolution against Panjab University's central status
312.article_body: Punjab Assembly has passed a resolution against giving Panjab University (PU) the status of a central university. Punjab Education Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer moved the resolution and called it a matter of identity, saying, "We will not let the central government centralise it at any cost." Only BJP MLAs Jangi Lal Mahajan and Ashwani Sharma opposed the resolution.

313.title: Time has come to say bye bye Modi: KT Rama Rao over price rise
313.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Thursday said that it was time to say "bye bye" to PM Narendra Modi. "The gas cylinder price in India is the highest in the world. Modi brought rupee value to ₹79 (against US dollar) in 75 years of Indian independence...Now the time has come to say 'bye bye Modi'," KTR said.

314.title: Bad news for Uddhav: Omar after Eknath Shinde sworn-in as Maha CM
314.article_body: After Eknath Shinde was sworn-in as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, former Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah said it was bad news for Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray and his branch. "Uddhav was probably counting on a BJP CM giving him a political weapon to target Shinde with," Omar said. This makes rebuilding Shiv Sena more difficult, he added.

315.title: BJP seeks ex-ally SAD's support for Droupadi Murmu in Prez polls
315.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda reached out to Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal to secure the party's support for NDA's candidate Droupadi Murmu ahead of Presidential polls. Notably, SAD left the NDA alliance over the contentious farm laws, which the Centre withdrew in 2021. Presidential elections are slated to be held on July 18.

316.title: Good govt being formed: Kesarkar after Shinde becomes Maha CM
316.article_body: After Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde was sworn-in as Maharashtra's Chief Minister, Shiv Sena MLA Deepak Kesarkar said that a good government was being formed. "Two parties that believe in Hindutva and had parted ways, have come back together," Kesarkar said. "Their tallest leaders...had no reservation about having a Deputy CM from their side," he added.

317.title: UAPA necessary to act against terrorists beheading people: Minister
317.article_body: Laws like the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) are "necessary" so that action can be taken against terrorists and those "who behead other people," Union Minister RK Singh said on Thursday. He said that UAPA is to "ensure that people are not killed", and "those who do not listen to diktats of terrorists are not wiped out".

318.title: PM Modi to unveil Alluri Seetarama Raju's statue in Andhra on July 4
318.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit Andhra Pradesh's Bhimavaram town on July 4 to unveil the statue of freedom fighter Alluri Seetarama Raju as part of Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav celebrations. Special Chief Secretary Rajat Bhargava on Thursday inspected the arrangements ahead of the event. PM Modi will unveil a 30-foot bronze statue in Bhimavaram Park and address the gathering.

319.title: B'luru's Kempegowda Int'l Airport crosses 250-million passenger mark
319.article_body: The Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru has crossed the 250-million passenger mark in its 15th year of establishment, Bangalore International Airport Ltd (BIAL) stated. The airport has also handled two million air traffic movements since its opening in 2008. BIAL said an additional 50 million passengers travelled from the airport in a span of nearly three years despite the pandemic.

320.title: Raj CM holds meeting over law & order situation after Udaipur killing
320.article_body: After meeting the family members of Kanhaiya Lal, who was murdered by two men on June 28 in Udaipur, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot held a meeting with officials over the law and order situation in the state. "Our police did a good job, arrested the accused and found international links...We'll appeal to take this case via fast track," Gehlot said.

321.title: 6 smugglers arrested, 670 gm heroin worth ₹1cr seized in Meghalaya
321.article_body: Six people were arrested in an operation against drug trafficking in Meghalaya and over 670 gm of heroin worth nearly ₹1 crore was seized, a top police officer said on Thursday. Police set up checkpoints in East Jaintia Hills district and arrested two persons, DGP LR Bishnoi said. After their preliminary interrogation, four more persons were arrested, he added.

322.title: 5 arrested in gangrape of woman, 6-yr-old daughter in Uttarakhand
322.article_body: Police on Thursday said they arrested five suspects in sexual assault and gangrape of a six-year-old girl and her mother in Uttarakhand's Haridwar. The girl and her mother were first sexually assaulted by a Haridwar resident who offered them a lift on his motorbike, and were again gangraped by four other accused who hailed from Uttar Pradesh, an official said.

323.title: June monsoon rains in India 8% below average: IMD
323.article_body: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the country has received 8% lesser rainfall than average in June. The IMD has attributed this to 54% lower rainfall as compared to normal in central India. Even though monsoons arrived on the coast of Kerala on May 29, its progress was stalled for over one week.

324.title: NATO declares China a 'security threat' for 1st time: Reports
324.article_body: NATO has listed China as a "security threat" for the first time, stating that the country's ambitions and its "coercive policies" challenge the bloc's "interests, security and values", reports stated. "China is substantially building up its military forces, including nuclear weapons, bullying its neighbours [and] threatening Taiwan," NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said at the bloc's summit in Madrid.

325.title: 5 protesters killed by security forces during protests: Reports
325.article_body: Five protesters were shot dead by security forces in Sudan on Thursday as thousands protested against the country's military leadership, reports citing a medical group said. Security forces also fired tear gas and water cannon on some of the protesters. Last October, the military led by General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan had toppled Sudan's transitional government.

326.title: EU, New Zealand strike free trade deal after 4 years of talks
326.article_body: After about four years of talks, New Zealand and the European Union (EU) on Thursday announced that they've concluded negotiations on a free trade agreement (FTA). "Trade between us should increase by 30%," European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen tweeted. "We managed to ensure a level playing field for EU investors in New Zealand and vice versa," she said.

327.title: Qatar donates $60 million to Lebanon's army amid economic crisis
327.article_body: Qatar has donated $60 million to Lebanon's army amid a severe economic crisis in the country. Since the crisis erupted in 2019, the Lebanese pound has lost over 90% of its value and tens of thousands have become jobless. Last year, Qatar had announced that it would support the army with 70 tons of food every month for a year.

328.title: Russia open to dialogue on nuclear non-proliferation: Putin
328.article_body: Russia is open to dialogue on strategic stability and nuclear non-proliferation, Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday. However, there aren't any plans for strategic talks between Russia and the US, a Russian government spokesman said. Despite the Russian invasion of Ukraine, both Russia and the US have stressed the importance of maintaining communication on the issue of nuclear arms.

329.title: John Visentin, CEO of printer maker Xerox, passes away aged 59
329.article_body: Printer maker Xerox Holdings Corporation's CEO John Visentin passed away due to complications from a long illness, the company said. "The Xerox family is profoundly saddened by this untimely event and extends its heartfelt condolences to John's wife, his five daughters and his family," the company added. The company has named President and Chief Operating Officer Steve Bandrowczak Interim CEO.

330.title: US Federal Reserve hikes interest rates by 0.75%, biggest increase since 1994
330.article_body: The US Federal Reserve System on Wednesday raised its key interest rate by 0.75%, marking the biggest rate hike made by the US central bank since 1994. "The committee is strongly committed to returning inflation to its 2% objective," the bank's policy-setting committee said. The move will raise US Fed's benchmark short-term rate to a range of 1.5% to 1.75%.

331.title: Not a hiatus, BTS will work as group while focusing on solo careers: BTS' label
331.article_body: The group's label HYBE clarified that BTS isn't going on a 'hiatus' and will work together as a group. "BTS isn't taking a hiatus. Members will be focusing more on solo projects at this time," read a statement from HYBE. This came after BTS, in a video, explained to fans that they need the time to take an extended break.

332.title: Mobile phones, SIM cards, cigarettes seized from 2 Punjab jails
332.article_body: Police said that 14 mobile phones and other prohibited items were recovered during search operations at Punjab's Goindwal Sahib and Amritsar central jails. After the recoveries, seven persons were booked in four separate cases. Apart from mobile phones, two SIM cards, six springs of heaters, 114 bundles of cigarettes and 79 packets of tobacco were recovered during the search operations.

333.title: BJP's countdown has begun: Cong over Rahul Gandhi's ED summons
333.article_body: As protests continue over the Enforcement Directorate's investigation against Rahul Gandhi, Congress' Nana Patole said, "The countdown has begun for the BJP government." The probe against Rahul Gandhi is being carried out "at the behest of the Central government", he added. "Now, the Delhi Police in tandem with the BJP has carried out atrocities on Congress leaders," Patole said.

334.title: India test fires Prithvi, 2nd nuclear-capable missile in 10 days
334.article_body: India carried out another test of its other nuclear-capable missile, Prithvi, nearly 10 days after the routine test of Agni was carried out. "The missile is a proven system and is capable of striking targets with very high precision," an official statement said, adding that the "user training launch successfully validated all operational and technical parameters of the missile".

335.title: Suriya to do a cameo in Akshay's Soorarai Pottru remake, shares post
335.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Suriya on Wednesday shot for the Hindi remake of his film 'Soorarai Pottru'. He will make a cameo appearance in the movie, which is headlined by actor Akshay Kumar. Taking to Twitter, Suriya wrote, "Akshay sir to see you as #VIR was nostalgic! @Sudha_Kongara can see our story beautifully coming alive again...Enjoyed every minute with the team."

336.title: EU signs gas deal with Egypt & Israel to reduce dependency on Russia
336.article_body: European Union (EU) signed a deal with Egypt and Israel to increase liquified natural gas (LNG) sales to EU countries on Wednesday in Cairo. The deal aims to reduce dependency on Russian oil amid Ukraine war. As per deal, Israel will send gas to EU countries via Egypt, which will liquify it for exports via sea, European Commission chief said.

337.title: CET exam centres to be camera-monitored to curb cheating in K'taka
337.article_body: Karnataka Higher Education Minister CN Ashwathnarayan said that students taking the Common Entrance Test (CET) in the state will be monitored by video cameras to limit possible fraud and other malpractices. CET exams are taken by students who wish to enrol in engineering, agriculture, veterinary and pharmaceutical courses. The examination will be held from June 16 to 18.

338.title: Kamla Nagar market will soon be known as pride of Delhi: Sisodia
338.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia inspected Delhi's Kamla Nagar market on Wednesday and said that it will soon be known as the "pride of Delhi". Kamla Nagar market is among the five key markets picked by the city government for redevelopment under its "Rozgar Budget", which aims to generate 20 lakh job opportunities in five years.

339.title: South filmmakers and writers have tremendous talent: Varun Dhawan
339.article_body: Varun Dhawan said south filmmakers and writers have tremendous talent. "SS Rajamouli sir is [at] top of the list. Then there are...many like Surender Reddy is great, the director who made F3 (Anil Ravipudi) he's got great comedy. The director of Pushpa (Sukumar) is amazing," he added. "There was a film which I...loved...It's a Malayalam film called, 'Premam'," Varun said.

340.title: Not having a partner is deepest regret of my life, it's too late now: Karan
340.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said he feels it's too late for him to find a life partner. "I think what a life partner does for you, a parent [or] a child, can never fulfil that," he added. "That's reserved for...your life partner [and] I don't have that. That's a vacant spot in my life and that's my deepest regret," Karan said.

341.title: Yogi govt to now use helicopters to check violence, riots in UP
341.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led UP government will now use helicopters to check mob violence, riots and arson in public places. UP government has sought proposals from Airbus Helicopters regarding the use of helicopters in tourism, policing, emergency medical services and law enforcement. The helicopters can also be used for rescue work and for fighting floods, said an Airbus representative.

342.title: 14-yr-old UP girl, mother die in sleep after table fan falls on them
342.article_body: Police said that a 35-year-old woman and her 14-year-old daughter died of electrocution in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj on Wednesday. The incident took place when they were sleeping in their house and a table fan fell on them. The two were electrocuted when they touched a bare wire while trying to move the fan, Maharajganj SP Dr Kaustubh said.

343.title: Will keep backing Russia on sovereignty: China's Xi tells Putin
343.article_body: Chinese President told his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin during a phone conversation on Wednesday that Beijing will keep backing Moscow on sovereignty and security issues. Xi reportedly praised the "good momentum of development" in bilateral ties. Notably, Russia and China opened a new cross-border bridge on June 10 to boost trade amid Western sanctions against Russia for Ukraine war.

344.title: 20-yr-old takes pics, videos of women in Mumbai society; arrested
344.article_body: A 20-year-old man, Sarthak Borade, was arrested by the police for allegedly taking photos and videos of several women in Mumbai's Grant Road area. Police said that a woman, who was noticing his behaviour since last year, confronted him and lodged a police complaint. "We have...recovered the photos and videos from his phone," a police officer said.

345.title: 2 people, including a 9-yr-old, drown in a pond in UP's Bhadohi
345.article_body: Police said that two people, including a minor, drowned in a pond while bathing in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi. The deceased have been identified as 19-year-old Sahil Ansari and nine-year-old Vishnu Valmiki. Ansari was bathing in a pond in Kunwarganj village when he began drowning and Valmiki tried to save him but he too drowned, Gyanpur police station SHO said.

346.title: This girl is famous, I'm obsessed: H'wood fashion designer on Uorfi's styling
346.article_body: Hollywood fashion designer, Harris Reed, praised model-actress Uorfi Javed's styling, as according to him she re-created a look from one of his collections.
