Taking to Instagram, Harris shared a reel and wrote, "This girl is clearly very famous who remade one of my show looks and has 45 million views. It is very obsessive and I'm really obsessed."

347.title: Which are the world's most expensive cities to live in?
347.article_body: Shanghai has topped the list of the world's most expensive cities to live in, as per Julius Baer Group's 2022 global wealth and lifestyle report. London, the capital of the United Kingdom, has been ranked second. Taipei, the capital of Taiwan, is at number three in the list, while Hong Kong and Singapore have been ranked fourth and fifth.

348.title: Beijing revokes licence of bar linked to latest COVID-19 outbreak
348.article_body: Beijing has revoked the licence of a 24-hour bar that is believed to be at the centre of a cluster of over 320 COVID-19 cases across several districts. A criminal case has been filed against the bar's owner for "breaching the law and conducting dishonest acts". Over 2,000 COVID-19 cases have been reported in Beijing since late April.

349.title: Rocketry script was torn into shreds, took me 1.5 yrs to rework it: Madhavan
349.article_body: R Madhavan, who made his directorial debut with 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', revealed that he had to redo his entire script after he spoke to the subject of his film, Nambi Narayanan. The actor-director said after that conversation, he could see his "script being torn to shreds" and it took him "another one and a half years to rework it".

350.title: Crypto market value falls below $900 bn as Bitcoin drops to $20,000 level
350.article_body: The value of the global crypto market fell to under $900 billion on Wednesday from a peak of $2.97 trillion in November 2020. Bitcoin, the world's largest crypto by market capitalisation, also fell 7.8% to $20,289, its lowest value since December 2020. Bitcoin has dropped around 30% in value since Friday and lost over half of its value this year.

351.title: Tripura Cong locks ED office in protest against summons to Rahul
351.article_body: The Tripura unit of Congress on Wednesday locked the local ED office in protest against the interrogation of party leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the National Herald money laundering case. Congress leader Sudip Roy Barman said the summons is a means to harass Gandhi, adding that PM Narendra Modi has "nothing to show people".

352.title: Delhi Police tore my clothes, removed my shoes during protest: Cong's Jothimani
352.article_body: Congress MP Jothimani has alleged that Delhi Police personnel assaulted her and tore her clothes while she was protesting against ED summons to Rahul Gandhi. Sharing a video online, she alleged, "They removed my shoes and carried me like a criminal." Jothimani added, "There are eight women on this bus and we repeatedly asked for water but they refused."

353.title: Sri Lanka to reserve fuel for cremations amid economic crisis
353.article_body: Sri Lanka has proposed to reserve a portion of fuel for cremation purposes, in accordance with Buddhist customs, amid shortage of fuel and other essentials in the country due to economic crisis. "We will supply [fuel to] bulk users that [are] hotels, hospitals and crematoriums," PM Ranil Wickremesinghe said. Sri Lanka will introduce a fuel rationing scheme from July onwards.

354.title: Rahul Gandhi questioned by ED for 3rd day, summoned again on Friday
354.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for further questioning on Friday in connection with the National Herald case. Rahul appeared before the Enforcement Directorate for the third consecutive day on Wednesday. He arrived at the ED Headquarters in Delhi at around 11.35 am on Wednesday.

355.title: Anil Kapoor remembers his mother, says 'She used to make clothes for me'
355.article_body: During a contestant's performance on 'Superstar Singer 2', Anil Kapoor remembered his relationship with his mother. "Mani and his mother have taken me back to my childhood. They've made me recall the machine (sewing machine) we used to own," he added. "The way you've made this shirt for him, my mother also used to make clothes for me," Anil said.

356.title: Hardik Pandya named captain as India squad for T20I series against Ireland announced
356.article_body: The All-India Senior Selection Committee on Wednesday announced a 17-member Team India squad for the two-match T20I series against Ireland. Hardik Pandya has been named captain of the squad, with several senior members of the squad being rested. Sanju Samson and Suryakumar Yadav have also been included in the squad. Meanwhile, Rahul Tripathi has received his maiden Team India call-up.

357.title: Groom dances, takes selfies in moving open roof Audi in UP; fined ₹2 lakh
357.article_body: A video of a groom dancing and taking selfies in a moving open roof Audi amid heavy traffic during a wedding procession in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar went viral online. The video showed his friends accompanying him in Audi and other cars and hanging out of windows and sun roofs of their cars. Muzaffarnagar Police said they've fined nine vehicles ₹2,02,000.

358.title: Nomination process for July 18 Presidential election begins
358.article_body: The Election Commission of India on Wednesday issued a gazette notification for the 16th Presidential election. With this, the process to file nominations for the July 18 election has begun. The nominations can be filed till June 29 and the scrutiny of the papers will be held on June 30, while the votes will be counted on July 21.

359.title: Will reduce effectiveness of armed forces: Rahul on 'Agnipath' scheme
359.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday reacted to the new military recruitment model 'Agnipath', stating that it will reduce the 'operational effectiveness of the armed forces'. "The BJP government must stop compromising the dignity, traditions, valour and discipline of our forces," he tweeted. 'Agnipath' proposes to employ aspirants (below officer rank) in the military for four years.

360.title: PURE EV scooter catches fire while charging in Gujarat; video surfaces
360.article_body: A PURE EV scooter caught fire while it was plugged in for charging in Gujarat's Patan. A video showing the e-scooter on fire outside a house also surfaced on social media. Last month, a PURE EV scooter caught fire in Hyderabad after stopping suddenly. The startup had recalled 2,000 e-scooters in April this year after incidents of fire were reported.

361.title: Won't give up on my hope of working with Kajol: Kichcha post his Twitter debate
361.article_body: Kannada actor Kichcha Sudeepa said he hopes that his recent Hindi vs South debate with Ajay Devgn does not affect his dream of working with the actor's wife and actress Kajol. "I had this great dream of working with Kajol ma'am...[it]...fell flat with this debate," he added. "I'll never give up on my hope of working with Kajol," Kichcha said.

362.title: High Court judge's daughter arrested for murder of shooter Sippy Sidhu in Chandigarh
362.article_body: Kalyani Singh, a Himachal Pradesh High Court judge Justice's daughter, has been arrested over the murder of national-level shooter and lawyer Sippy Sidhu in Chandigarh in 2015. "There was a delay in the arrest but I still believe in law," said Sippy's mother. She told the police that Kalyani called Sippy to a park on the day he was killed.

363.title: Russia's territorial ambitions are from Warsaw to Sofia: Ukraine Prez
363.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Wednesday that Russia's territorial ambitions aren't limited to Ukrainian cities but rather stretch to capital cities of Poland and Bulgaria, Warsaw and Sofia. He made these remarks while virtually addressing Czech Republic's parliament, seeking additional sanctions by EU against Russia. EU has adopted six rounds of sanctions against Russia so far.

364.title: Singer B Praak's baby passes away at the time of birth
364.article_body: Singer B Praak on Wednesday shared that his baby passed away at the time of birth. "It's the most painful phase we are going through as parents. We would like to thank all the doctors and the staff for their endless efforts," he said. The singer and his wife Meera Bachan announced in April they were expecting their second child.

365.title: Surat Cong, villagers complain about water pollution by textile mills
365.article_body: Congress leaders along with residents of Parab village in Surat complained to district collector and Gujarat Pollution Control Board (GPCB) officials about untreated waste being discharged from textile mills into Kadodara creek in Kamrej. "The industrial units have violated pollution norms," Darshan Naik, former LoP in Surat district panchayat said. Parab village has a population of 2,000 people.

366.title: Pics show Varun, Kiara eating inside Mumbai metro; people ask 'Is it allowed?'
366.article_body: Anil Kapoor, Varun Dhawan and Kiara Advani took a ride in the Mumbai metro on Tuesday amid promotions of 'Jug Jugg Jeeyo'. After visuals of Varun and Kiara eating inside the metro surfaced, an Instagram user commented, "Is eating allowed inside the Metro?" while another comment read, "Are rules meant only for common people?"

367.title: Forest fire destroys rare chilgoza trees in Himachal's Kinnaur
367.article_body: The forest fire in the high-altitude Kinnaur district of Himachal Pradesh raging since the past few days has been brought under control, but has destroyed hundreds of rare chilgoza pine and juniper trees. "The fire affected 2,000 bighas," Kinnaur Deputy Commissioner said. The chilgoza pine nuts, consumed locally and sold abroad, are a source of livelihood for Jangi village residents.

368.title: Bad sign for healthy democracy: Cong's Pilot after being detained
368.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot, after being detained for trying to enter the party office, said that his detention was a bad sign for a healthy democracy. "I don't know what next they plan to do with us. This sort of detainment has never happened before. This behaviour in a civil society is just not done," he said.

369.title: This is cute, I had no idea: PhonePe CEO on reports of company filing for IPO
369.article_body: Hours after reports came out that PhonePe is considering raising funds through an initial public offering (IPO), its Founder and CEO Sameer Nigam said he had no idea about it. "This is cute. I had no idea my own company is filing an IPO," he wrote. Reports said the company is seeking a valuation of $8-10 billion.

370.title: Supreme Court to hear plea against demolitions by UP govt tomorrow
370.article_body: Supreme Court will on Thursday hear a petition seeking directions to the Uttar Pradesh government to follow rules while carrying out demolitions in the state. The petition was filed by Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind. It sought due notice and opportunity of hearing to each of the affected persons. This comes days after authorities demolished the house of Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammed.

371.title: Thought dad died in Ghulam, I started howling: Deepak Tijori's daughter
371.article_body: Actor Deepak Tijori's daughter Samara Tijori spoke about the time when she thought her father died after she watched a scene featuring him in Aamir Khan-starrer 'Ghulam'. Samara said, "I was 5-6. I saw that train sequence, and that's a...well-cut sequence, you actually feel someone's hurt." "I saw...and I thought my dad died. I started crying and howling," she added.

372.title: Police use water cannons on BJP workers protesting against Kerala CM
372.article_body: Kerala Police used water cannons and tear gas to stop BJP Yuva Morcha members as they protested against CM Pinarayi Vijayan, demanding his resignation over the gold smuggling case. The BJP workers staged a protest outside the Secretariat in Thiruvananthapuram. The protests came after the prime accused in the gold smuggling case, Swapna Suresh, claimed CM's involvement in the scam.

373.title: Sharad Pawar refuses to contest for Presidential post
373.article_body:
NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday refused to contest for the upcoming Presidential election. 
"I sincerely appreciate the leaders of opposition parties for suggesting my name as a candidate for the election of the President of India, at the meeting held in Delhi. However I like to state that I have humbly declined the proposal of my candidature," Pawar said.

374.title: Mumbai sees 33% rise in daily COVID-19 cases to 2,293, highest since Jan 23
374.article_body: Mumbai reported 2,293 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, which is the highest since January 23 this year. This is a 33% rise in COVID-19 cases from Tuesday's 1,724 cases. The city also reported one death due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate stood at 13.37% and the number of active cases rose to 12,341.

375.title: Production of fuel more than sufficient to take care of demand surge, clarifies govt
375.article_body: Dismissing rumours of a shortage, government clarified that production of petrol and diesel in India is more than sufficient to take care of any demand surge. "This unprecedented growth has created some temporary logistics issues at local level. Oil Companies have geared up to tackle these issues by increasing...stocks," said government. This follows reports of fuel shortages in various states.

376.title: Panvel civic body issues notice to remove illegal hoardings: Report
376.article_body: The Panvel civic body has issued a notice to remove all unauthorised banners, posters, flex boards or hoardings across the city, reports said. The civic body warned of stern action if the banners are not taken down. It has also asked political parties and citizens to take permission before putting up hoardings in public places or on building rooftops.

377.title: Appoint nodal officers to check waterlogging issues in Pune: BJP
377.article_body: BJP leaders have asked the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to appoint nodal officers to review the waterlogging situation in the city as part of the administration's pre-monsoon arrangements. "The civic body needs to...do traffic management to avoid chaos during the monsoon," BJP leader Sandeep Khardekar said. PMC earlier claimed that it had cleared 76 waterlogging-prone spots in the city.

378.title: Sales tax official caught while accepting ₹20 lakh bribe in Thane
378.article_body: An Assistant Commissioner of sales tax department from Thane was arrested by Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) for accepting a bribe of ₹20 lakh from a hotelier. The accused has been identified as 42-year-old Dhananjay Janardhan Shirshat. "The complainant...told us that Dhananjay...demanded ₹30 lakh for the past assessment and for getting new GST number for his hotel," an ACB official said.

379.title: BESCOM to add 140 EV chargers in the next 6 months in Bengaluru
379.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) has said it will add 140 EV chargers in the next six months in order to strengthen the electric vehicles' charging network. BESCOM MD P Rajendra Cholan said that tenders have been invited to set up 1,000 EV charging stations across Karnataka. "Currently, BESCOM is operating 136 EV chargers in Bengaluru city," Cholan added.

380.title: Delhi sees a 23% jump in new COVID cases to 1,375; positivity rate rises to 7.01%
380.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 1,375 new COVID-19 cases, a rise of 23% from 1,118 cases recorded the previous day. The city's COVID-19 positivity rate rose to 7.01% from Tuesday's 6.5%. Delhi reported zero deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the active cases stood at 3,643, as per a health bulletin.

381.title: Sonu Sood helps Indian man stuck in Thailand, says 'Had to bring you back'
381.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood rescued a man stuck in Thailand. Recently, a person named Sahil Khan took to Twitter seeking the actor's help. Replying to him, Sood stated that he'll send the tickets. On June 13, Sahil tweeted, "Finally reached India...true gem @SonuSood." Sood retweeted the post and wrote, "You're my Indian brother, had to bring you back."

382.title: Gujarat woman stabs husband to death to save son from being thrashed
382.article_body: A 40-year-old woman was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly stabbing her 45-year-old husband to death in order to stop him from beating their son. The woman, a resident of Gujarat's Ahmedabad, used a kitchen knife to attack her husband on Monday night. The deceased was going to thrash his son as he wasn't able to access a few TV channels.

383.title: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies as per Hurun list?
383.article_body: Reliance Industries with a value of ₹18,87,881 crore is India's most valuable company, according to Burgundy Private Hurun India 500- Special Report. It's followed by Tata Consultancy Services, HDFC Bank, Infosys, ICICI Bank, Adani Green Energy, Bharti Airtel, Housing Development Finance Corporation, Bajaj Finance and Kotak Mahindra Bank. The total value of these companies is ₹71.8 lakh crore.

384.title: Sidharth Malhotra goes on a bike ride with Sadhguru, shares pics
384.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor Sidharth Malhotra shared few pictures of a bike ride with Sadhguru for 'Save Soil Movement'. In one picture, Sidharth and Sadhguru could be seen sitting on bikes and posing for the camera. In the photos, Sidharth is seen wearing a white T-shirt, while Sadhguru donned a yellow t-shirt with Save Our Soil written on it.

385.title: PM Modi to visit his mother in Guj on her 100th birthday on June 18
385.article_body: PM Modi is likely to visit Gujarat on June 18 to visit his mother, who will be turning 100 that day. A celebration has also been organised at the Modi's native town of Vadnagar in the Mehsana district by Hiraba's (PM's mother) sons in the evening. "Hiraba's presence at the event will depend on her health," said Prahlad Modi.

386.title: Bihar woman constable thrown off moving train while resisting thieves
386.article_body: A woman constable of Bihar Police was on Wednesday thrown off a moving train while she was resisting a theft bid in the state's Katihar district. "Around four miscreants tried to snatch my purse and mobile phone and when I resisted their bid, they pushed me off," the injured constable said in the hospital.

387.title: Ambala tourist, instructor killed as paraglider crashes in Himachal
387.article_body: A tourist from Ambala and a paragliding instructor were killed after their paraglider collided with a hill soon after take-off in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district. The incident took place in the Dobhi area of the district. Post-mortem is being done in a nearby hospital, Kullu Superintendent of Police (SP) Gurdev Chand Sharma said.

388.title: The Fuel Delivery to soon offer doorstep delivery of CNG in Mumbai
388.article_body: Energy distribution startup The Fuel Delivery will soon begin doorstep delivery of CNG to customers in Mumbai. The service, which will start from places like Sion and Mahape initially, will be extended across the city soon. The startup has signed a Letter of Intent with Mahanagar Gas Limited (MGL) for the round-the-clock service which will begin in next three months.

389.title: Prayagraj police to put up posters of violence accused on roadsides
389.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj will put up posters of people allegedly involved in the June 10 violence on roadsides and in public places to identify them, officials said. Police will also circulate these posters on social media platforms and their houses will also be attached. The violence broke out after Friday prayers over remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

390.title: Fire breaks out at commercial building in Pune, no casualties reported
390.article_body: A fire broke out in the basement of a commercial building in Pune's Shivajinagar area on Wednesday morning. No casualties were reported due to the fire, which damaged a set of documents of an automobile sales company. Officials suspect that a short circuit in the electrical system in basement could have led to the blaze.

391.title: WHO explores reports of monkeypox virus in semen
391.article_body: The WHO is looking into reports that the monkeypox virus is present in the semen of patients, to check the possibility that the disease could be sexually transmitted, WHO's Catherine Smallwood said. "This may have been something that we were unaware of in this disease before," she said, adding that most frequent mode of transmission is associated with skin-to-skin contact.

392.title: DOGE founder shares 'death knocking' meme to suggest real estate crash, Musk says 'True'
392.article_body: Dogecoin Co-founder Billy Markus has suggested that real estate may be the next thing to collapse after stock and crypto markets. He posted a meme with death opening doors in turn and leaving pools of blood behind each of them. Tesla CEO and the world's richest man Elon Musk replied to the tweet by writing, "True."

393.title: 2.4 mn hectares of winter crops won't be harvested due to war: Ukraine
393.article_body: Ukraine's Agriculture Ministry said around 2.4 million hectares of winter crops with a total value of $1.435 billion will remain unharvested in the country because of Russia's invasion. So far, the agriculture sector has suffered losses of $4.292 billion because of the invasion, it added. Some 92,000 cows and 258,000 pigs have been killed in areas affected by fighting.

394.title: Musk-owned SpaceX's Starship will be ready for orgital flight in July
394.article_body: SpaceX's Starship vehicle will be ready for orbital flight next month, said Founder and CEO Elon Musk in a tweet on Tuesday. "I was in the high bay and mega bay late last night reviewing progress," Musk said in response to a query regarding Starship's orbital flight. "We'll have a second Starship stack ready to fly in August," Musk added.

395.title: Aaditya Thackeray, Shiv Sena leaders perform aarti in Ayodhya's ISKCON Temple
395.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray, along with other Shiv Sena leaders, performed aarti at ISKCON Temple in Ayodhya's Ramnagar on Wednesday. "Recalling the relationship between Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray and ISKCON Mumbai," Thackeray tweeted while sharing a video of the aarti. "I am grateful for the invitation and love to visit ISKCON Ramnagar," his tweet further read.

396.title: Ryanair drops Afrikaans nationality test for S Africans amid backlash
396.article_body: Ryanair has dropped a requirement for South African passengers to prove their nationality by taking a test in Afrikaans language. This comes after the move, which was aimed at weeding out fraudulent South African passports, received backlash from the country's government. Afrikaans is spoken by around 12% of South African population and was linked to apartheid era in the country.

397.title: Opposition parties adopt resolution to field common candidate for Presidential election
397.article_body: The leaders of several Opposition parties on Wednesday adopted a resolution to field common candidate for the upcoming Presidential election, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee said. "This is a good beginning. We sat together after several months, and we will do it again," she added. The parties included Congress, Shiv Sena, NCP, SP, PDP, National Conference, RJD and DMK among others.

398.title: Aamir to host reunion party for the team as Lagaan completes 21 yrs: Reports
398.article_body: Aamir Khan will reportedly host a reunion party at his home as Lagaan completed 21 years. To celebrate the legacy of the film, the cast will reunite at Aamir's residence today. Last year, the team had a virtual reunion to celebrate 20 years of the film. Meanwhile, on the professional front, Aamir will be next seen in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

399.title: I've aged, I don't show my aggression unless a batter provokes me: Chahal
399.article_body: India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, on being asked about his subdued wicket celebrations by opener Ruturaj Gaikwad, jokingly said, "Now that I have aged, I don't show my aggression unless a batter provokes me." He added, "It's just a normal celebration...There are friends who are batting at the other end." Chahal registered figures of 3/20 in the third South Africa T20I.

400.title: France captures senior Islamic State member in Mali
400.article_body: French troops in Mali have captured a senior member of the Islamic State militant group, French Armed Forces Ministry said. Oumeya Albakaye was captured on the intervening night of June 11-12 close to the border between Mali and Niger, it added. This comes as France prepares to complete its withdrawal from Mali, where it has been fighting ISIS since 2013.
